loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has a coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Rosita makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for the clearing and plowing of land and the holing and planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Rosita wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for the clearing and plowing of land and the holing and planting of seedlings.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita makes good earnings every quarter on her coconut farm in Palayan, Aloran. This is the primary source of income for her family. Anita makes it a point to prepare the land well for planting more dwarf coconut seedlings. This preparation gives her the maximum yield and generates a good income. Recently, she needed an amount to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Anita wishes to sustain her business and to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings

loans.name: Jarde

texts.en: Jarde, 57, is married with three adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 13 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
The 2008 recession hit Detroit hard—a challenge that Mark and his professional design services company has been force to tackle in recent years. But with his perseverant and driven attitude, Mark is determined to make a comeback. He has, after all, been practicing for 40 years. 

Born in Detroit, Mark moved back to the city later in life to practice architecture in a true urban environment. He started his practice in a spare room of his house in 1975, but within a year, he had outgrown the space. His company consists of a small group of architects, engineers, and interior designers who provide professional design services for new and renovated schools, churches, factories, apartment buildings, and other institutional facilities in Detroit and Southeast Michigan. They have had hundreds of clients. 

Unfortunately, the recession caused a long-term loss of clients and a lack of loan services to help him expand and improve his company. With this loan, Mark will expand his social media and online presence, commence an intense new marketing campaign, and upgrade software and computers. In the future, he hopes to “compile a group of competent and capable young designers, ready, willing and able to carry forward my 40-year reputation for providing high-quality, professional and timely design services for another 40 years.” It is important to note that Mark started this business with the goal of providing quality redevelopment services in Detroit. As it is a city that is just beginning to get back onto its feet, Mark and his company are exactly what Detroit needs. 

Check out his website at www.medesignsllc.com

loans.use: to improve social media, online advertising, and marketing, and to upgrade software and computers

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, responsable, paciente y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ situado en cercanías al lago sagrado Titicaca, caracterizado por contar con edificaciones de piedra. Herederos de  la destreza para observar y mantener vivas las costumbres ancestrales, las ceremonias que realizan son místicas y espirituales, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Jhonny es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que son mayores de edad y no trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado, él se encarga de visitar las ferias de la zona en busca de terneros para engordarlos y venderlos. Actividad que le quita todo el tiempo porque su negocio es constante. “el comercio de ganado es una actividad ancestral que se práctica mucho en este lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la experiencia que tiene es de toda su vida, la desventaja es el clima del lugar que hace que no exista forraje en abundancia. Su sueño es construir un establo grande dónde entren más cabezas de ganado, el desea realizar la compra de ganado vacuno y lechero para engordarlos y venderlos. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Jhonny solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno y lechero para criarlo y venderlo a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a 29-year-old man. He is single, doesn't have children, and makes a living buying and selling cattle.

He is independent, enterprising, responsible, patient, and works very hard.

He runs his business in the area of Batallas, which is located next to the Sacred Lake Titicaca and is known for its stone constructions. The climate is dry and cold, with a temperature that varies between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius (32 and 54 degrees Fahrenheit) during the day. Heirs to the skills to observe and keep alive the ancient customs, the inhabitants perform mystical and spiritual ceremonies.

Jhonny is short, with a slim build. He has a tanned complexion, short black hair, and brownish-gray eyes. His mother tongue is Aymara, which is spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish for general knowledge and business purposes. He shares his life with his parents, who are elderly and don't work anymore. They live in their own home—an adobe house that has a corrugated iron roof, electricity, and a well water.

His business is selling cattle. He is in charge of visiting the livestock shows in the area looking for calves to fatten them and then sell them. This occupation takes up all of his time because his business is nonstop. He says that "selling cattle is an ancient occupation that is being practised a lot in this area …" 

The advantage of his business is his lifetime experience in the field, and the disadvantage is the area's climate, which causes a shortage of fodder.

His dream is to build a big stall where he can fit more cattle. He wants to purchase beef and dairy cattle to fatten and sell.

This is his third loan cycle with the institution in 11 years that he has been following this occupation independently.

For these reasons, Jhonny is requesting a loan to purchase beef and dairy cattle to raise and sell for the best price.

loans.use: to purchase beef and dairy cattle to raise and sell for the best price.

loans.name: Cyclin

texts.en: Cyclin is 45 years old and a widow. She has been a meat vendor in their town for almost 10 years. From this long experience of selling, she already has high knowledge in dealing with this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Cyclin still gets more customers than the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her children's education. For now, Cyclin is planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business, which will be managing a piggery business for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase three pigs at 300 kilos for her shop and pay for construction materials for pig cages, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs at 300 kilos for her shop and pay for construction materials for pig cages.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Elma has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is 49 years old, resides at Larena, Siquijor, Philippines, and is married. He joined PMPC in January of 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, he's accessing his third loan of PHP 25,000 for additional working capital for his existing business. He will use the loan to buy a variety of commodities which he is selling in the local community, including a variety of processed meat products and frozen goods.

loans.use: to buy a variety of processed meat products and other frozen goods

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is from Siquijor, Philippines. He is 51 years old. He and his partner have three children, one of whom is still in college. In the year 2012, he joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. From his desire to provide his family with what's best for them, he engaged in selling fish in different barangays in Maria, Siquijor. Only his motorcycle was used as his source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell the fish. His source of income has existed for three years now. In need of additional working capital, he requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC of PHP 30,000 to purchase more stock of fish to sell and supply in the market. Through this, he hopes to increase his income so he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family.  He is also happy that he can support the education of his children, which is his main priority. In the future, he wishes to own a truck for his fish delivery because he wants to become a fish stockholder in his town.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell and supply in the market

loans.name: Gladys Beatriz

texts.es:
Gladys, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en un barco pesquero, tiene 3 hijos pero solo una hija vive con ella y está estudiando.

Gladys, tiene venta de ropa y de bisutería que administra desde hace 10 años y lo aprendió de su mamá, ella compra la ropa por mayoreo en San Salvador y en Santa Rosa de Lima, también tiene una venta de papitas fritas.

Gladys, solicita el crédito para comprar ropa y comprar bisutería, para poder surtir el negocio.

El sueño de Gladys, a un futuro es construir su propia casa, porque por el momento está alquilando, además, desea ahorrar para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Gladys is 38 years old. She studied through second grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in a fishing boat. She has three children, but only one daughter lives with her and is now studying. Gladys sells clothing and fashion jewelry which she has managed for the past 10 years. She learned the business from her mother. She buys the clothing wholesale in San Salvador and in Santa Rosa de Lima. She also has a french fries stand. Gladys is asking for a loan to buy clothes and fashion jewelry to supply her business. Gladys' dream in the future is to build her own house because she rents currently. In addition, she wants to save to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and fashion jewelry to supply her business.

loans.name: Richmon

texts.en:
Richmon is engaged in running a grocery store. He has been operating his business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP. Richmon is 33 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is from Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Richmon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richmon has successfully repaid his previous loans from PMPC. Recently, Richmon requested a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of his existing business. He wants to buy more inventory for his store to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his store to increase his stock.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Rosario has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs. Rosario wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family with a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs

location.town: Dipolog-Lawag Galas Dipolog CityZamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa, a widow, is 62 years old and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena. In order to survive, she sells rice cakes. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2013, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP14,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store and pay for additional raw ingredients to make her rice cakes, because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to repair her house and live comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store and pay for additional raw ingredients for making her rice cakes.

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Chiquita

texts.en:
Chiquita is from Lopez Jaena in the Philippines. She is married to a farmer and has five adult-aged children.

Unable to support the family on her husband’s income, Chiquita opened a sari-sari, or general store. She began selling a few basic groceries to her neighbors.

In January, 2011 she joined PMPC, which helped her in the financing of her sari-sari. She became a MIGS (Member In Good Standing), which is why she has received several loans already. Now she is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise for her store. She hopes to grow her store successfully into a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her sari-sari

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Unfortunately she almost lost her capital when her husband became seriously sick. PMPC came to the rescue for Lolita so she could gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase grocery items to add to her store's inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to add to her store's inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita operates a motorcycle transport ("habal-habal") business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

For Angelita to continue operating her business, she has borrowed a loan to pay for motorcycle spare parts and repairs. She dreams of owning more motorcycles and being able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle spare parts and repairs

loans.name: Mageline

texts.en:
Mageline, aged 34, is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Marciano and the mother of her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mageline operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy biscuits and other food items from wholesalers and then she sells them to customers at a profit. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales daily.

To help her to continue operating her business, Mageline is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She will utilize the loan to buy more biscuits, cookies, mallows and Filipino candies like "yema" and "piaya" to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mageline hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, cookies, mallows and Filipino candies like "yema" and "piaya".

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, aged 54, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo and the mother of her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Alicia's store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help Alicia to continue to operate her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia dreams of  expanding her store into a supermarket. She hopes that her family will always be in good health and free from any sickness. Alicia meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, aged 44, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Allan. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elisa operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, selling these items with a little profit. Her products include men and women’s pants and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options that Elisa offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, Elisa is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy bed sheets, women's clothes, pants, rejuvenating sets and bleach to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as her business expands.

Elisa hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy different merchandise such as bed sheets, women's clothes, pants, rejuvenating sets and bleach.

loans.name: Cfjdt 19 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 19 est un sous groupe affilié à la Convergence des Femmes et Jeunes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de femmes et d'hommes qui habitent dans le même village et font pratiquement les mêmes activités. Ils se réunissent chaque fin de mois pour organiser des tontines. Madame Sokhna est la présidente, elle est reconnue sur la photo par la main levée. Sokhna évolue dans la commercialisation des céréales et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et stocker du mil, maïs, arachide et des haricots pour les revendre pendant la saison des pluies. Sokhna a une expérience de plus de 2 ans. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle souhaite avec l'aide de l'institution avoir un grand magasin de stockage afin de diversifier et augmenter ses produit. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
CFJDT 19 is a sub-group affiliated with the Convergence of Women and Youth for the Development of Tassette. It consists of men and women from the same village who practically conduct the same activities. They meet each month-end to organize tontines (savings groups).

Mrs. Sokhna is the president, and can be recognized in the photo as she is raising her hand. She is active at marketing grain cereals and is requesting this amount to buy and store millet, maize, groundnuts and beans, for resale during the rainy season.

Sokhna has over two years' experience. She helps her husband in managing daily expenses and her children's tuition fees. She starts her day at 8 am to finish at 5 pm.

With the help of the institution she wants to acquire a large warehouse where she can diversify and expand her products. Thus she will be able to increase her revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy grains like millet, maize, groundnuts and beans, to store and resell them during the rainy season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase his working capital and buy lots of clothes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Joicy

texts.en: Joicy is 35 years old. She is married with four children and they live in Plaridel, Philippines. Joicy is managing her fishing business and owns a fishing boat. Joicy has employed three fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat to the market and neighboring towns. She earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family, especially her children's education. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul; and purchase fishing equipment and accessories. In the future, Joicy hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business and be able to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul; and purchase fishing equipment and accessories

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is a widow and a father of three adult-age children and has worked as a driver for the past 30 years. His business involves motor for hire or public transport. He does this work to support his children. He asked for a loan to purchase a cab for his motorbike. This will increase his income and he would be able to support his needs.

loans.use: to purchase a cab for his motorbike

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
From Pasay City Philippines, Flordeliza has been an active member of CCT for years now and she was able to acquire several loans to help make good profit from her business. She is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs and she was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure enough that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Flordeliza owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone of making her dreams happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, a toothpaste or even ice. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to make a profit.

She wants to manage a bigger store someday so she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and and she looks forward to seeing her youngest child finish his studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Flordeliza meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages and toiletries needed to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.en:
This is Crisologo, 36, resident of GMA Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jocelyn and they have children. They manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Crisologo is in the puppet-making business. He creates marionettes, a type of puppet that is controlled by strings. He has been making puppets for twelve years now and he earns well from this. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy the raw materials and supplies that he needs to design and create more puppets. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Crisologo dreams to expand his business and he also wants to have additional source of income so he can provide more for his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed in puppet-making

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis es una empresario alegre, emprendedor, alentado, el busca su futuro con sus propias manos, no espera que nadie le dé nada.
Con mucho esfuerzo logro montar un negocio que es un café bar, paralelo en su negocio ofrece dichas bebidas, pone música y se convierte en un bailadero muy agradable donde las personas se divierten y se salen de su monotonía. 

El es un padre cabeza de familia, su pequeña es de 1 año, lucha porque estudie y tenga una vida digna. 

Luis Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de bebidas alcohólicas precisamente Cerveza, Ron, Aguardiente. Con este préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar los clientes, incrementar su utilidad y seguir haciendo que la gente goce de un momento agradable.
texts.en:
Luis is a happy, entrepreneurial and encouraged businessman. He seeks his future with his own hands and doesn't hope for anyone to give him anything.

With a lot of effort, he was able to start a cafe/bar business. Side by side, he offers the mentioned drinks, plays music and becomes a very nice dance hall where people enjoy themselves and leave their monotony behind.

He is the father head of house. His young daughter is one year old, and he strives so she can study and have a decent life.

Luis seeks a loan to buy a selection of alcoholic beverages; specifically beer, rum and spirits. With this loan, he hopes to improve his sales, increase his customers, improve his usefulness and continue making people have a good time.

loans.use: to buy a selection of alcoholic beverages; specifically beer, rum and spirits.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
From GMA Cavite Philippines, Nenita has been an active member of CCT for years now and she was able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from her business. At the age of 48, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs and she was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her family the best for their future. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Nenita owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone of making her dreams happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, a toothpaste or even ice tube. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit.

She wants to manage a bigger store someday so she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that her business will continue to flourish and she looks forward to seeing her children having stable jobs.

Nenita meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages that she needs to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Aku est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans et mère de deux enfants. Aku vit à Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Aku vend des charbond de bois dans son quartier  pour avoir son revenu. Aku s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Aku demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en:
Aku is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She lives in Adidogome where she runs her business.

Aku sells charcoal in her neighborhood to generate her income. She resupplies twice a month at the market.

Aku is requesting this loan to buy bags of charcoal and make some profit, so she can support her husband with family expenses and ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy 25 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Dans le quartier de Ségbé, vit  Afi avec ses quatre enfants. Mariée et âgée de 39 ans, Afi est revendeuse de charbon de bois et gagne son revenu journalier grâce à cette activité. Afi stock les charbons dans sa maison et cède ensuite aux clients qui viennent en chercher. Afi s’approvisionne au marché trois fois par mois. Pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi and her four children live in the Segbe district. Married and 39 years old, Afi retails charcoal and earns her daily living from this activity.

Afi stocks charcoal in her house and then sells to customers who come to purchase. She resupplies three times a month at the market.

To buy new bags of charcoal, Afi is requesting this loan so she can complete her purchase and generate income conducive to her family's development.

loans.use: buy 13 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy groundnuts

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo vit à Ségbé et est âgée de 36 ans. Mariée, Adzo est mère de quatre enfants et travaille activement pour favoriser leur éducation. Adzo vend des produits d’alimentations et des poissons fumés dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu de subsistance. Adzo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers de poissons et des tomates fraîches, Adzo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire
texts.en:
Adzo lives in Segbe and is 36 years old. She is the married mother of four children and is actively working to promote their education.

Adzo sells food products and smoked fish in her neighborhood to generate subsistence income. She resupplies three times a month at the market.

To order baskets of fish and fresh tomatoes, Adzo is requesting this loan so she can complete her purchase and generate the necessary profits.

loans.use: 8 buy baskets of fish and 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita. She is 57 years old and currently resides with her husband, Antonio, in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than eight years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also makes and sells rugs for her additional profit. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Estelita would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She will also buy raw materials and supplies needed in making more rugs to sell. 

Estelita hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business, and she dreams of her children becoming successful in the future. She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, and also the raw materials she needs to make more rugs to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 58 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, who are now adults but one is still at school. 

Divina earns her living from the sales and services of her coconut lumber, hard wood dealing, hauling and trucking services business. She has been doing this for 10 years now. She earns approximately PHP 30,000 each month doing this type of business activity. At present, she is also employed as a clerk of the court in one of the courts in this province. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional trunks of coconut trees to be processed into lumber to sell. Divina has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her coconut lumber and wood dealing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional trunks of coconut trees

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, a 58-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Taguig City, Philippines, has been running his office and school supplies business for fifteen years, and he makes a good income from this. He is married, and he and his wife are determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs.

A school/office supplies store is where one can buy school supplies, like a pen, bond paper, cartolina and the like, without going to a bookstore. He gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve his profit, Armando is taking out PHP 15,000 loan assistance, which he will use to buy products and other materials. An increase in his inventory will give a favorable boost to his income.

Armando hopes to grow his business and improve their present financial condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of the school and office supplies he needs to increase his product inventory.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 56, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is alone in supporting her child and managing their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elizabeth operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy biscuits from a wholesaler and then sells them to her customers with a profit. She also has a fruit and vegetable stand, and sells frozen food products, for their additional profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of biscuits, varieties of fruits and vegetables, and frozen food, to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elizabeth hopes her business will prosper and that their life will improve. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of biscuits, different varieties of fruit staples, vegetables and frozen food.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
This is Elisa. She is 40 years old and she lives in Taguig City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs. She and her partner have had to work hard and they are determined to have a better income.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Elisa would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Elisa wants to make improvements to their house, and she dreams of always have sufficiency in everything. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other merchandise which she needs to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Messi

texts.fr: Messi est une femme mariée et âgée de 31 ans. Messi habite le quartier de Ségbé avec ses quatre enfants et travaille pour leur épanouissement. Messi vend les produits d’alimentations générales et des céréales dans on quartier afin d’avoir le revenu nécessaire. Messi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour acheter des tomates, des gombos et quelque sac de maïs. Messi souhaite tirer assez de profit afin de soutenir l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Messi is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives in the Segbe neighborhood with her four children and works to ensure their development.

Messi sells general food products and cereals in her neighborhood to generate the income she needs. She resupplies three times a month at the market, and is requesting this loan to buy tomatoes, okra and a few bags of maize.

Messi would like to generate enough profit to support her children's education.

loans.use: buy tomatoes, okra and bags of maize

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel   de  32 años  de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus  tres hijos en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de camarón y pescado. Su negocio ubicado en  el mercado de Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, en su negocio el vende camarón cocinado, camarón frescos, sardinas y pescado, Don Miguel es un joven trabajador y emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante. 
Don Miguel esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de 2 quintales de pescado y 4 de camarón para vender en esta época de semana santa, con el apoyo del financiamiento él desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento, es su tercer crédito que solicita a prisma, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con prisma.
Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que actualmente renta el lugar donde vive con su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old. He lives with his wife and his 3 kids in his residence. He has been selling shrimp and fish for the last 10 years. His business is located in the Nacaome Market, in a valley in the South of Honduras. He sells cooked shrimp, fresh shrimp, sardines and fish. 

Miguel is a young hard-working and enterprising man. He wishes to thrive. He is requesting the loan to buy 2 quintals of fish and 4 of shrimp to sell over the Easter holidays. With this funding, he wishes to cover the need for further funding. This is the third loan he requests. He is very happy to keep working with Prisma. His dream is to own a house since the one he and his family live in is rental property. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2015

loans.use: To buy 2 quintals of fish and 4 of shrimp to sell.through his business.

loans.name: Yudis

texts.es:
Yudis es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 
Desde hace 23 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas.
Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor como tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Yudis manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yudis is a woman who is dedicated to her family and work.  Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead and overcome different obstacles that she has encountered.

She started her beauty salon 23 years ago, setting it up in her home.  She also offers door-to-door services if required.  She works eight hours a day every day, which has allowed her to earn enough income to help her husband with the household expenses and to cover her only son's needs.

The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies wholesale such as hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, etc. so she can continue her work and provide her customers with a fuller service.  This will make her more agile and efficient, which will increase the profit she earns from her work.

Yudis says her greatest goal is to continue her activity and confirm and strengthen her business so it becomes more competitive in the market.  This will give her more capacity to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale supplies such as hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Gladis Stella

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Santa Fe De Antioquia desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como almuerzos y desayunos.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Gladis y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Gladis desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Gladis is a humble, hard-working woman who has spent much of her life caring for her children.  She lives in the municipality of Santa Fe de Antioquia where she is amazing in the kitchen, as her business is preparing foods for breakfast and lunch, on an order basis.

Most of her food is sold to neighbors in the area who are familiar with Gladis' cooking.  They know she always has well-made, delicious foods.

Gladis wants to increase food sales and work a little easier, so she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her food recipes, such as chicken, flour, cheese, etc.

This loan will allow her to continue her business and earn the income necessary to continue supporting her family.  She is being given this opportunity by Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food recipes, such as chicken, flour, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Jeovanny

texts.es:
Edwin, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero y tiene dos hijos, su abuela vive también con él, pero solo sus hijos dependen económicamente de él.

Edwin, tiene venta de lácteos desde hace un año, aprendió el trabajo con un amigo que tiene ese mismo negocio, también trabaja como agente de seguridad, su negocio está a 3 minutos desde su casa, en el negocio se involucra otro miembro de la familia para atender el negocio, el horario es desde la 6:30 a.m. hasta las 3:30 p.m.

Edwin, necesita el crédito para comprar queso, crema y otros lácteos, el préstamo le servirá y mejorará su negocio ya que tiene poca mercadería.

Sus sueños son, tener un gran negocio donde pueda vender toda clase de productos lácteos, también espera que sus dos hijos puedan estudiar y que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Edwin, 30, has a high school education.  He is single and has two children.  His grandmother also lives with him but only his children are dependent on him financially.

Edwin has been selling dairy products for a year, having learned the trade from a friend in the same business.  He also works as a security agent.  His business is three minutes away from his house, and another relative helps him attend to the business.  The work schedule is from 6:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Edwin is in need of a loan to buy cheese, cream and other dairy products.  The loan will allow him to improve his business since he has little merchandise on hand.

His goals are to have a larger business where he can sell all kinds of dairy products.  He also wants his two children to get an education and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy cheese, cream and other dairy products.

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.es:
La señora Ruth tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería junto a su esposo (Ver Foto) que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días durante 12 horas.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar maquinaria para la preparación de sus panes.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada teniendo en cuenta que para este tipo de negocios se necesitan algunas herramientas especiales.
texts.en:
Ruth has vast experience in the bakery business.  Some time ago she started her own bakery with her husband (in the Photo), and the business has reported very good results until now.

She always has preferred to work independently, and her schedule is 12 hours a day, every day.

She currently needs help to buy equipment to make bread.  The loan will allow her to work under better conditions while guaranteeing the quality of her products.

Her greatest goal is to have a large bakery and supply different shops.  With this support she will be able to work in a more organized fashion, bearing in mind that for this type of business special tools are necessary.

loans.use: To buy equipment to make bread.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde y al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene aproximadamente 6 años de experiencia en esa actividad comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuatro toretes y asi seguir con la crianza para tener mejores ingresos y seguir ayudando en su hogar.
texts.en: The face of this young man has been blurred as he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. He earns a living breeding cattle to fatten up and growing basic grains. He has around 6 years of experience in this work in the outskirts of the area where he lives. What he earns from his sales helps him with his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy four young bulls and to therefore continue raising cattle in order to have a better income and continue to help in his household.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
O senhor Ernesto tem 58 anos de idade, é casado pai de 5 filhos, 3 dos quais maiores de idade trabalhadores e 2 menores  ainda a estudar.Alem dos filhos sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ele na casa cedida pela instituição onde ele trabalha.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar ferro, cimento e casquilhos para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro e ver terminada a construção da sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz  poupanças. Diz que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Fifty eight year old Ernesto is a married father to 5 children, 3 of whom are grown up and in work and the remaining 2 are still studying. Asides from his children, he also supports his young niece who lives with him in the house, provided by the institution where he works.
He says that he plans to use this loan to buy iron bars, cement and sockets so that he can continue with building work on his house.
His dreams and hopes for the future include finishing the building work on his home and buying a vehicle for his own personal use.
He tells us that the greatest challenge that he faces is his lack of funds but he puts money away in savings to help him overcome this situation. He plans to apply for further loans in the future so that he can fulfil his plans.

loans.use: to buy iron bars, cement and sockets

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
O senhor  Luis  tem 45 anos de idade, é casado pai de 5 filhos, 2 dos quais maiores de idade e casadas, 3 ainda menores e a frequentar a escola.Alem da sua família sustenta os pais, mas estes não vivem com ele. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar ferro e chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa de banho.
Seus sonhos para o futuro e melhorar sua vida e ter um estabelecimento comercial na zona dos seus pais. 
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz um xitique mensal como forma de poupar e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Luis is a 45 year old married father to 5 children, 2 of whom are fully grown and married and the remaining 3 are still living at home and attending school. Asides from his family, he also supports his parents although they do not live with him. He says that he plans to use this loan to buy iron bars and zinc sheeting so that he can continue with building work on his bathroom. His dreams for the future include improving his living conditions and establishing a shop in the area where his parents live. He says that the greatest challenge he faces is his lack of funds, consequently, he is part of a monthly xitique, an informal communal credit and savings group, which helps him to overcome this situation. In the future, he hopes to apply for further loans so that he can fulfil his plans.

loans.use: to buy iron bars and zinc sheeting

loans.name: Madalena

texts.pt:
A senhora Madalena tem 34 anos de idade, é casada mãe de 4 filhos 2 dos quais a estudar e os outros ainda menores. Além dos filhos sustenta 4 irmãos enviando lhes dinheiro, vive na sua própria casa. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, barrotes, areia e chapas de zico.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro e melhor sua vida e reabilitar a sua casa. 
Diz que tem como desafios a insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz  poupanca e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en: Madalena is a 34 year old married mother to 4 children: 2 of whom attend school and the other 2 are of pre-school age, and they all live in their own home. Asides from her children, she also sends money to her 4 siblings. She says that she plans to use this loan to buy cement, beams, sand and zinc sheeting. Her hopes and dreams for the future include improving her life and renovating her home. She says that the greatest challenge she faces is her lack of funds and that she saves her money in order to overcome this situation. She plans to apply for further loans in the future so that she can fulfil her plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, beams, sand and zinc sheeting

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Micaela continua con su  negocio de venta de ropa como casacas, pantalones entre otros, la socia vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican la venta de ropa, productos de belleza, venta de ropa (lencería), tienda de abarrotes.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y  salud.
texts.en:
Micaela belongs to the "Micaela Bastidas" communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco Province, in the Department of Cusco. 

Micaela is still continuing with her business selling clothes such as dress coats and trousers among others. She sells to all of the customers who request these items. Micaela is grateful for the loan given to her and is committed to making her repayments on time. She has been running her business for a good time now which is going well thanks to the determination she puts in to her business everyday, because this is how Micaela helps her family to get ahead.

Micaela is asking for this loan in order to buy jumpers among other things. The other group members work selling clothes, beauty products, lingerie, or running a grocery store.

The members that appear in the inset photos asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work and/or health reasons.

loans.use: to buy jumpers and other clothes.

loans.name: Engel Oswaldo

texts.es:
Engel es un joven de veinticinco años de edad, humilde y sencillo, cursa su último año de la licenciatura en psicología. Aunque no le ha sido fácil su trayecto académico y muchas veces ha pensado en abandonar la carrera, ha seguido poniendo todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante y cumplir con su vocación de ayudar a las personas que realmente necesitan un soporte emocional. Él ha sido apoyado por su madre, la cual deja que labore en su tiempo libre en su negocio de cafetería, para así ganar dinero y pagar la universidad, también, es impulsado por su esposa, que vende joyas de plata para aportar a su hogar y garantizar el bienestar de su hijo de casi dos años. 
Ahora que este perseverante joven está a un paso de coronar su carrera, solicita la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito mediante un préstamo que le permita cancelar los gastos de su curso de titulación, ya que si no tiene su título no puede insertarse en el mundo laboral de forma certificada. En un futuro planea especializarse en psicología para niños, lo que más desea es convertirse en un profesional exitoso para mejorar la condición de vida de sus seres queridos y contribuir al desarrollo del país.
texts.en:
Engel, 25, is a simple and humble young man. He is in his final year of Psychology. It has not been easy for him to stay in school and he has thought of quitting. However, he has continued to work hard to get ahead and become someone that can help those in need of emotional support.

His mother has always helped him. She owns a cafeteria, where he works during his free time in order to earn some money to pay the university fees. His wife also helps him; she sells silver jewelry and contributes to the home expenses and the sustenance of their son, who is almost two years old. 

This persistent young man is very close to finishing his studies. He is requesting Kiva’s and MiCrédito’s help through a loan to pay the graduation fees. Without a degree, he will not be able to work as a certified professional. In the future, he plans to major in child psychology. His biggest wish it to become a successful professional, improve the life of his beloved ones, and contribute to the development of the country.

loans.use: to pay the graduation fees.

loans.name: Marta De Jesus

texts.es:
Marta, de 59 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltera y vive con su hija y su nieto, su hija trabaja y su pequeño nieto estudia.   

Marta, tiene crianza de pollos desde hace un año, desempeñar ese trabajo fue idea de una amiga y Marta, decidió arriesgarse y le funciono el negocio, aparte de eso ella, todos los días sale a vender antojitos a las casas de su comunidad.

Marta, solicita el crédito para comprar concentrado para pollos, porque ella los vende cuando tiene el tamaño y el peso apropiado. 

Marta, sueña con tener una granja más grande, donde no solo tenga pollos, sino también cerdos y producir más, para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is 59 years old. She only went to school up to the second grade. She is single and lives with her daughter and her grandson. Her daughter works and her little grandson goes to school.  

Marta has been raising chickens for a year. Doing this work was a friend's idea, and Marta decided to take a risk and the business worked out for her. In addition to this, she goes out every day to sell snacks to the homes in her community. 

Marta is asking for the loan to buy concentrate for chickens, because she sells them when they have reached the appropriate size and weight. 

Marta dreams of having a bigger farm where she will have not only chickens but pigs, and it will produce more to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for chickens, because she sells them when they have reached the appropriate size and weight.

loans.name: Carlos Salvador

texts.es:
Carlos, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y vive con su esposa, la cual se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Carlos, tiene una pequeña tienda que fue heredada por su madre y tiene un año de administrarla, aparte de la tienda, también trabaja eventualmente en una fabrica, la tienda está en su casa y su esposa se encarga de ella cuando Carlos sale a trabajar fuera; el horario de atención en la tienda es de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. 

Carlos, necesita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, jabón, aceite, entre otros productos para la tienda y comprar una refrigeradora para almacenar los productos y que no se le arruinen.

El sueño más grande de Carlos, es ser padre y que cuando su hijo nazca, pueda tener la capacidad económica de brindarle todo lo necesario para que crezca sano.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old. He went to school up to high school. He is married and lives with his wife, who takes care of the home. 

Carlos has a little store that was inherited from his mother and which he has been running for a year. In addition to the store, he also works sometimes in a factory. The store is in his house and his wife runs it when he has to go work elsewhere. The store is open from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. 

Carlos needs the loan to buy rice, beans, soap, oil, and other products for the store and to buy a refrigerator to store the products so they don't spoil.

Carlos' biggest dream is that when his son is born he will have the financial capacity to offer him everything he needs to grow up healthy.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soap, oil and more for his store, as well as a refrigerator to store the products so they won't spoil.

loans.name: Nomis Armida

texts.es:
Nomis, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijas, las cuales estudian, mientras que su esposo trabaja de motorista de un camión, transportando arena para construcción.

Nomis, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años; anteriormente trabajaba haciendo tortillas junto a una amiga, ahora lo hace con la ayuda de sus 2 hijas cuando no estudian, la tortilleria la tiene en el patio de su casa todos los días, se levanta muy temprano a preparar todo y vende hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Nomis, está solicitando el crédito para reparar el techo de donde vende sus tortillas y también para comprar maíz porque actualmente está a bajo precio.

Nomis, sueña con que sus 3 hijas lleguen a estudiar hasta la universidad y sean profesionales.- También, con colocar una tortillería en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Nomis is 40 years old. She went to school up to the ninth grade. She is married and lives with her husband and their 3 daughters, who are in school. Her husband works as a truck driver, transporting sand for construction. 

Nomis has sold tortillas for 4 years. She used to sell tortillas with a friend. Now she does it with the help of her 2 daughters when they are not in school. She has the tortilla business in the patio of her house every day. She gets up very early to make everything and sells until 3 in the afternoon. 

Nomis is asking for the loan to repair the roof where she sells her tortillas, as well as to buy corn because right now it is at a low price. 

Nomis dream of her 3 daughters going to college and becoming professionals. Also, to open a tortilla business in the center of town.

loans.use: to repair the roof where she sells her tortillas and also to buy corn because right now it is at a low price.

loans.name: Ana Belkys

texts.es:
Estudiosa, dedicada e innovadora, es Ana, una joven de veintidós años de edad, a la cual le apasiona la química y composición de medicamentos. Actualmente estudia el último año de la carrera de Química y Farmacia. A ella también le interesa solidarizarse con las personas necesitadas es por eso que labora en un dispensario de alimentos y medicamentos para una comunidad. Sus padres son su principal inspiración para salir adelante y convertirse en una gran profesional. 
Ana está, a un paso de graduarse, pero antes tiene que cursar unos módulos de clases, obligatorios para tramitar su título, es por eso que ella ha solicitado a Kiva con MiCrédito un préstamo para cancelar dichos módulos y así obtener su título e insertarse en el mundo laboral. En un futuro ella planea poner su propia farmacia, además de colaborar en jornadas de salud para niños de escasos recursos, a la misma vez desea seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Studious, dedicated, and innovative, Ana is a young woman who is 22 years old and is passionate about chemistry and drug composition. She is currently in the last year of her chemistry and pharmacy major. She is also interested in showing solidarity with people in need, and that is why she is working in a food and medication dispensary for a community. Her parents are her primary inspiration to get ahead and become a great professional.

Ana is a step away from graduating, but before doing so she needs to take some courses required to complete her degree. It is for that reason that she has requested a loan from Kiva with MiCrédito to pay for said courses and obtain her degree and enter the working world. In the future, she plans on starting her own pharmacy, in addition to collaborating in health days for low-income children. At the same time, she wants to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for required courses and therefore obtain her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes for women and other products.

loans.name: Jhonny Alexander

texts.es:
Jhonny, de 27 años, inicio con un negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de equipos de computo hace aproximadamente 5 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus padres y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y agradecerles por todo lo que lo han apoyado.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra repuestos e insumos para la reparación de computadores.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio.

Apoya a Jhonny para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Jhonny, 27 years old, began with a business repairing and maintaining computers approximately 5 years ago with the desire to seek work that would generate income to be able to survive.

At the moment, he gets his motivation to work tirelessly from his parents and it is in this way that he wants to offer them the best for their life and thank them for everything that they have given him.

He asks for a loan to purchase spare parts and supplies to repair computers. 

With this loan, he will be able to sustain his business.

Support Jhonny so that he can continue with his work!

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and supplies to repair computers.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
En las manualidades encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Adriana que a sus 45 años es una mujer con gran talento y pasión por este arte.
Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de papel, cintas, colores, entre otros insumos para la fabricación de bolsas de regalo y decorativas, lo cual le permitirá continuar con su arte con el cual ha intentado obtener algunos ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y aportar con la economía de su hogar.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de oportunidades para crecer y desarrollarse, pero poco a poco intentara tener una vida mejor.

Apoya a Adriana con su arte y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo.
texts.en:
In handicrafts, many people find the opportunity to progress and get ahead in a humble way and with a lot of courage. This is the case for Adriana who, at 45 years old, is a woman with a lot of talent and passion for this art.

She asks for a loan to purchase paper, ribbons, colors, and other supplies to make gift and decorative bags, which will allow her to continue with her art, with which she has tried to get some income for the support of her children and to support the household economy.

One of the greatest difficulties that she has had to confront is the lack of opportunities to grow and develop herself, but bit by bit she tries to have a better life.

Support Adriana with her art and make her life better with a loan.

loans.use: to purchase paper, ribbons, colors, among other supplies to make gift bags.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Patricia es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
Ella prepara y vende tintos y comestibles en el municipio de Itagui, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Trabaja sola durante 8 horas todos los días.
El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima como café y surtido de frituras, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Patricia's perseverance and courage, her household can have a respectable life. 

She prepares and sells coffee and food in the municipality of Itagui, work that she undertook with the desire to look for new income to sustain her family.

Her husband and her children are the greatest motivation that she has to work daily and put forth the effort so that each day can improve. 

She works alone for 8 hours every day. 

She hopes to be able to boost her business with the purchase of supplies and raw materials such as coffee and an assortment of fried foods. Corporación Interactuar and the Kiva lenders can provide this boost.

With these elements, she will be able to have her foods available for her customers all the time.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same zone to not lose her customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and raw materials such as coffee and an assortment of fried foods.

loans.name: Yurley Alejandra

texts.es:
Yurley es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo de dos meses brindándole un buen sostenimiento.

Yurley es madre soltera y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Yurley tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Le dedica 5 horas diarias a su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Yurley is a very hard-working person who, thanks to her daily efforts, has managed to get her 2-month-old son ahead, offering him good sustenance. 

Yurley is a single mother and a long time ago, she began to sell personal products from a catalog. With a lot of effort, she has overcome many problems that have come up.

Currently, Yurley has some good orders from her customers and since she doesn't have a lot of capital, she is looking for a loan to purchase personal products and to respond to the big orders that her customers have.

She works 5 hours each day at her business. 

Her greatest dream is to get ahead with her business and from there be able to offer her son a good quality of life and better economic stability. She knows that with the hand of Interactuar, she can achieve it.

loans.use: to purchase personal products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, who is in his early 30s, is single with two children. One goes to school and other one is still  small.  He has been a tailor since 2005.  He works from 08am to 07pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Alex's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy better and more materials and managed to make suits which met his customers' requirements.  He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees for his kid and his young brother's fees, loan repayments, and covered household expenses.  

He will use this loan to  buy materials for making good dresses and suits.  He dreams of opening a barber shop.

Alex will make sure he pays back his loan successful.

loans.use: to buy materials for making good dresses and suits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more glass.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheets and more.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La socia Mary continua  con su negocio de artesanía como por ejemplo muñecas, guantes, gorros y entre otros, la socia se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad y agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos entre otros.
texts.en:
Mary continues with her crafts business such as, for example, dolls, gloves, hats and more. She is happy for the loan and commits to making the payments punctually and responsibly and is grateful to all the investors for the loan and wants them to continue supporting other projects. She is a responsible and determined person. She continues selling her merchandise to her customers that ask for it, and in this way she gets her family ahead. 

She asks for the loan to purchase sweaters, shirts, and more.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, shirts, and more.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.
