She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional products like groceries, toiletries and beverages. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Marilou hopes that all her children will be able to finish their studies. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for  their daily needs and pay their expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more  if you will lend her an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase on sales will also result to a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Francisca also operates their fruit and vegetable stand for additional profit. She dreams that her children will have a good life in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
Ma. Lolita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy groceries and other supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve their financial condition more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 30,000 PHP. Ma. Lolita now focuses on their rental house, and this new loan will go to the maintenance of their space. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Ma. Lolita wants that her children will be able to complete their studies. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of their rental house

loans.name: Bexa Maria

texts.es:
Bexa, de 39 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Puerto Salgar, en este negocio vende ensaladas, obleas, entre otros alimentos.

Bexa trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

 Enfrenta múltiples dificultades como el costo de los insumos, la competencia en el sector y las fuertes lluvias que azotan su puesto de trabajo.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar una mesa de trabajo e insumos para sus ensaladas.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bexa, 39 years old, has decided to open a food business near her house located in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. In this business she sells salads, wafers, and other foods. 

She works every day from 6 in the morning to 1 in the afternoon. She is a very responsible, level-headed and diligent woman with her business.

Among her unrealized dreams is to be able to have a restaurant that offers different kinds of foods and can provide jobs. 

She confronts several difficulties such as the cost of supplies, the competition in the sector, and the strong rains that lash her work location.

She asks for economic support to stock up her business and purchase a work table and supplies for her salads.

The loan will impact her life and her business in a very favorable way because she will be able to realize her dream and she will have a greater variety of food to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a work table and supplies for her salads.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Adolfo es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de La Dorada.
El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de alimentos como condimentos, frutos secos, granos, entre otros.

Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas solo
Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de estos alimentos. El ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuando un cliente le hace un pedido, intenta satisfacer su necesidad a toda cabalidad. 

Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su edad.
El solicita un préstamo para compra de surtido de granos, frutos secos, entre otros.
 
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para su sostenimiento.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a veteran of a thousand battles survived over the length of his life. He lives in the municipality of La Dorada.

He is a very hard-working man and for some time he has been working in the business selling food such as seasonings, dried fruits, grains, and more. 

He works alone every day for 8 hours.

His business consists of buying and selling these foods. He offers these products as a street vendor and when a customer makes an order, he tries to satisfy their needs perfectly.

He says that it is a simple business to do at his age.

He asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of grains, dried fruit, and more. 

The loan will give him the opportunity to capitalize his business and to give his work a considerable boost, permitting him to get resources for his sustenance.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of grains, dried fruit, and more.

loans.name: Joanne Carla

texts.en:
Joanne Carla is a 27-year-old college undergraduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. She is married to Christian, an OFW who has been working as a kitchen staff in Kuwait for four years. They have two children, aged 7 and 5, and they live at her grandmother's house. Their total monthly family income is only Php10,000 ($226). 

Joanne Carla has long seen the need to help her husband, but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. 

Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. 

Once Joanne Carla starts earning, she can help provide for her family's basic needs and then save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children who are still going to school.  She has been running a general store since 2007.  She works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwasiti's eleventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the store's inventory, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit pay school fees, loan repayments, and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to increase the general store inventory.   

She dreams of buying a plot of land and build her own house.

Mwasiti will make sure she pays back the successfully.

loans.use: to increase the general store inventory..

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy groceries and other supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 12,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries and beverages. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Elvira wants to add more items in her store to increase her profit. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nancy Estela

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Nancy, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Ceja, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante.

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 13 horas.
Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa y tendrán toda la hospitalidad y amabilidad que buscan.

Nancy ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de sus deliciosas recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hard-working, Nancy is a warrior woman who has worked a large part of her life taking care of her children. She lives in the municipality of La Ceja, where she earns her living with the preparation of a variety of foods such as lunches and breakfasts in a small restaurant. 

She works alone every day for 13 hours.

Her foods are known by the neighbors in the sector, who come to her restaurant because they know that they will be able to eat deliciously and it will have all the hospitality and friendliness they look for. 

Nancy has decided to improve her business and increase her sales, for this reason she asks for a loan to purchase ingredients and supplies to prepare her delicious dishes. 

This loan will allow her to get her business ahead to also get the earnings necessary to give her the opportunity to continue sustaining her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams a reality!

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to prepare her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 53 years old and married with three children. One of her children is in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Yarenis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yarenis es una madre de un pequeño hijo de ya 4 años de edad y por el cual ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerlo y brindarle todo lo que necesita.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como artículos para el hogar, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su hijo.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un surtido de electrodomésticos, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Yarenis is the mother of a 4-year-old little boy and for this she has struggled tirelessly to sustain him and offer him everything he needs.

She found, in the sale of merchandise such as household items, the way to generate good earnings while being near her son.

These days, she is beginning with very little capital and is in the stage of gathering customers. For this reason, she asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of appliances, and more, in bulk, and in this way to stock her little business with quality products.

With the help of a loan, she will be able to boost her business and will have a better variety of products to sell, managing in this way to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of appliances.

loans.name: Martha Lina

texts.es:
Martha desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco margarita empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene una hija que es su más grande adoración.
Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Madruga todos los días para trabajar en sus negocio durante 9 horas.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas; además desea realizar el mantenimiento preventivo a sus maquinas.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha learned the work of sewing clothing from a very young age thanks to her mother who all her life was a seamstress and it was in this way that, little by little, she began to understand and apply this knowledge. 

She has a daughter who is her greatest devotion.

She is an enterprising woman, loving, and always ready to serve her customers in the best way.

She is very grateful for all that she has been able to build up to now with the help of Corporación Interactuar.

She gets up early every day to work at her business for 9 hours.

She asks for economic support to purchase sewing supplies such as fabric, thread and needles. In addition, she wants to do some preventative maintenance on her machines.

She has a lot of hope in her business and has the idea of having a much larger workshop in which she could offer jobs and increase her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Sara Emilsen

texts.es:
Sara es una joven mujer de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta  de pan tradicional.
Ella es inteligente, entusiasta, alegre, feliz, constante y muy responsable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘plan 4000’ caracterizada por su distribución urbana; tomando en cuenta una estructura de anillos, fue la primera ciudad del país que contó con un plan regulador y un parque industrial que normaron el desarrollo urbanístico en su etapa de despegue y modernización, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el díe entre 22-35 grados centígrados.
Sara es de tez trigueña, baja estatura, cabello castaño largo usa peinado tipo rayitos y lo amarra, ojos marrones, complexión física delgada, viste a la moda, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan tradicional, como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Zonzo (Puré de yuca mezclado con queso y formado en un palito para luego cocinarse al horno), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo),Salteña (Masa delgada de trigo rellena con carne, papas, huevo duro y verduras y horneadas), negocio que inicio hace 1 año, desde su casa, realizando una mínima inversión. También hornea queques de vainilla y tortas de chocolates que llevan insumos fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la oferta de pan. “el pan cruceño se caracteriza por ser muy sabroso, se le agrega bastante leche e ingredientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que lo realiza en su casa y no tiene que trasladarse a otro sitio, la desventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con la capacidad de producción para vender por mayor, debido a que su horno es pequeño. Su sueño es tener una panadería grande y vender por mayor a tiendas de barrio, ella desea realizar la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Sara solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa para vender pan a tiendas de barrio por mayor.
texts.en:
Sara is an 18 year old young woman, single, with no children, and her business is making and selling traditional bread. 

She is intelligent, enthusiastic, happy, cheerful, reliable and very responsible. Her business is located in the Plan 4000 neighborhood, characterized by its urban distribution, having a ring-like structure. It was the first city in the country that had a master plan and an industrial park which established the urban development in its initial and modern stages. It has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 22 and 35 degrees centigrade. 

Sara has dark skin, is short, has long brown hair that she ties back and keeps highlighted, brown eyes, thin physique, dresses fashionably, her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She lives her life in the company of her parents who work. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a metal sheeting roof that has water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is making and selling traditional breads such as cuñapé (a small roll made of yucca flower with cheese) , empanada de arroz (a baked good with rice and cheese), zonzo (mashed yucca mixed with cheese and made into a stick shape then baked in the oven), bizcochos de trigo (hard rolls made of wheat flour), salteña (light dough made of wheat, filled with meat, potatoes, boiled eggs, and vegetables, and baked), a business that she began a year ago from her house, making a small investment. She also bakes vanilla cakes and chocolate pastries that use ingredients easy to find in the market. As she recovered her capital, she invested in her bread sales. "The bread of Santa Cruz is characterized as being very flavorful, one adds a lot of milk and ingredients..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she does it in her house and doesn't have to go to another site.  The disadvantage of her business is that she doesn't have the production capacity to sell in bulk, due to having a small oven.  Her dream is to have a large bakery and sell in bulk to the neighborhood stores. She wants to purchase an industrial oven and a cylinder of gas to expand her business. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year she has been doing this work.  

For these reasons, Sara asks for a loan to purchase an industrial oven and a cylinder of gas to sell bread to neighborhood stores in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial oven and a cylinder of gas to sell bread to neighborhood stores in bulk.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ludy is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a scrap-buying business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap for her business.

Ludy has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Ludy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap for her business.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como almuerzos y desayunos típicos de Antioquia. 

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Maria solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra insumos como arroz, granos, carne, entre otros, para abastecer su pequeño restaurante casero y atraer mas clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a very enterprising and determined woman, with great desire that she has cultivated and is trying to realize. 

She has a small business preparing and selling food such as lunches and breakfasts typical of Antioquia. 

With this work, she tries day by day to get ahead and improve the living conditions of her family, made up of two children who are the driving force of her life and her motivation to struggle daily.

Her greatest difficulty is the competition in the sector, but with her great capacity for work, she is capable of sustaining herself and progressing. 

Maria asks for a loan to purchase supplies such as rice, grains, meat, and more, to stock her small home restaurant and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, grains, meat and more.

loans.name: Willyam De Jesus

texts.es:
Willyam es padre responsable de un hijo; desde hace aproximadamente 30 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor como blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, entre otros, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada; mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Willyam, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Willyam is a responsible father of one child. For approximately 30 years, he has worked as an independent salesman, work that he learned on the job and that came up from the necessity of generating resources to sustain his family. He offers all sorts of products such as clothing, accessories and more and has the advantage of meeting new people daily to whom he can offer his merchandise, improving his sales every day. 

He is now asking for a loan to purchase merchandise in bulk such as shirts, jeans, shoes, accessories, and more, so that he can stock up with more variety to satisfy the demand that increases in this season, improving his level of sales. 

Willyam, with determination and dedication, wants to continue working to get his business ahead, since in the near future he dreams of having the possibility of opening a shop in a retail space where he can offer a better variety of things and generate profitability and a favorable economic stability to give his son an excellent education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk such as shirts, jeans, shoes, accessories, and more.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Roberto, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.
El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 20 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Trabaja solo todos los días durante 6 horas.
Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para arreglar su carreta y comprar una un amplio surtido de verduras y de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
The sale of fruits and vegetables is the work that Roberto does, a man with drive and perseverance to get his own business and his family ahead.

He has worked in this business for over 20 years, working from very early in the morning every day to offer his foods. 

He works alone every day for 6 hours.

He decided to undertake this project when he saw the need to get more income for his family and because he didn't have enough education for a different job, he decided to sell fruits and vegetables. 

He is a likeable and helpful man, always ready to attend the questions and desires of his customers.

He asks for economic support from Corporación Interactuar to repair his cart and purchase a wide assortment of vegetables and in this way stock up and sell a greater quantity of food.

His dream is to have a retail space where he can peacefully and comfortably sell his food.

Come on, loan and support today!

loans.use: to fix his cart and purchase a wide assortment of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a printer and stationery

loans.name: La Retama Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA RETAMA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa ella es casada y tiene 35 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Communal bank “LA RETAMA”; This bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 
Carmen Rosa is one of the members. She is married, 35 years old and has a son. She has a grocery store. She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has already worked 5 years in this business and she is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice. 
The members with the attached pictures to the group one had their picture taken after the meeting, because they were excused due to work obligations. The other members work in the businesses of handcrafts, sale of clothes, grocery stores and sale of food. 
Carmen Rosa is grateful to those who are part of this dream. Through this means she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan for fertilizers for a productive farm. Through her earnings, she is able to meet her daily needs and help her aging parents. Due to her health and age, she decided to switch into a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business. 

She would now like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy various kinds of fruits and vegetables like bananas, pineapple, cabbage and other vegetables and fruits to sell. Gloria already has regular customers and she also brings some of her fruits to a stall in her town market.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely cover her and her parents daily sustenance. 

Gloria dreams of having a permanent place in the public market to serve a wider base. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables from a wholesaler and sell them at a retail price.

loans.name: Ma. Lucia

texts.en:
Ma. Lucia is 35 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Lucia has a buy and sell scrap business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy scrap to sell.

Ma. Lucia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Estela

texts.en:
Ma. Estela is 39 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Ma. Estela works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Estela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like coffee, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Ma. Estela has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Ma. Estela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like coffee, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Niña

texts.en:
Ma. Niña is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 24 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Niña has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Ma. Niña has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Maribel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elsa Amanda

texts.es:
Elsa es una joven muy enfocada en sus objetivos, con solo veintitrés años de edad, logra dividir su tiempo entre el trabajo y el estudio.  Actualmente está en su último año de la licenciatura  en administración de empresas. Ella estudia los sábados, ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja como profesora de los alumnos de primer año de su misma carrera. Su madre, es la principal persona que le da fuerzas para seguir adelante en su camino académico, además le ayuda económicamente para que pueda costear los gastos, propios de la vida de un estudiante.
Esta persistente joven, necesita una computadora laptop para poder terminar su tesis, planear sus clases de forma rápida y actualizada, además de realizar sus trabajos en tiempo y forma, es por eso que ella recurre a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que le brinden un préstamo y con este comprar la computadora portátil, que es esencial para su buen desempeño académico. En un futuro ella quiere especializarse en pedagogía para universitarios, ha descubierto que enseñar es su vocación.
texts.en:
Elsa is a young woman with very clear objectives. She is only twenty-three, and manages to work and study at the same time. She is now in her final year of Business Administration. She studies on Saturdays, and works from Monday to Friday teaching first-year business students. Her mother is her main support and motivation to finish her studies. She also helps her with some money so that she can cover her expenses more easily.

This persistent young woman needs a laptop computer to finish writing her thesis, better prepare her lectures, and be able to meet the deadlines and improve the quality of her work. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan through MiCrédito to buy a portable computer and improve her performance. In the future, she would like to specialize in pedagogy for university students, since she realized that teaching is her vocation.

loans.use: to buy a portable computer.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan which she will use as her part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, canned goods, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and provide for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Linda dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mariche

texts.en:
Mariche is 39 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mariche runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Mariche has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, Mariche would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marife works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Marife is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy stocks of beverages to sell for her buy and sell beverages business.

Marife has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 41 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jesusa has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like junk foods, coffee, home product care and other groceries.

Jesusa has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like junk foods, coffee, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joy is 40 years old and has one child in school.

Joy has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Joy has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Maa Adishakti Group-C

texts.en:
Anuchhaya, the lady standing first from the right, has been involved in a clothes selling business for the last six years to earn additional income for her family. She has a good collection of new designs of sarees, dress materials, kids clothes, etc., and sells them to her customers. 

Anuchhaya has many loyal customers due to the maintained standard of good quality and new designs of clothes. One more advantage that she gives to her customers is that she also sells her products on installments. 

To buy the latest fashion clothes in bulk quantities, she seeks financial support through Kiva, which will save her transportation costs and travel time. She lives with her family consisting of her husband and a child.

Anuchhaya and her group have requested a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy the latest fashion clothes in bulk quantities. She is thankful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to buy the latest fashion clothes in bulk quantities

loans.name: Maa Adishakti Group-D

texts.en:
Basanti, the lady standing first from the right, lives in a small villge in Sonepur district of Odisha. She is a petty shop owner and has been in the business for 13 years. She works 10 hours a day and earns 3,000 INR a month. Her husband is not working presently, and the onus of running the household is on her and her eldest son. Her second son is currently doing his schooling. 

Maintaining a good rapport with customers has helped Basanti to build a strong customer base. She buys grocery items directly from the farmers and sells them to the customers at a reasonable price. Quality household items are also sold in her shop. She says transportation is the main challenge in her job apart from lack of finances. She says she will use the loan amount to purchase extra items for her store and enhance the business.

Basanti and her group have requested this loan to invest in their respective business.

loans.use: to purchase extra items for her store and enhance the business

loans.name: Maa Adishakti Group-A

texts.en:
Sabita, the lady standing first from the left, has been offering tailoring services in her village in the Sonepur district of Odisha. At present, her husband is jobless, and therefore, she tries to manage her household expenditures, including their children's schooling needs, using her income. 

With an investment of 12,000 INR, she will be able to procure an embroidery machine, which will help her in getting additional assignments from her regular customers, who are happy with her designs, the quality of finishing and timely delivery. Her neighbors and relatives also seek her services because of the good quality. At present, she is unable to accept specialized assignments in the absence of an embroidery machine. Local, private money lenders demand high interest rates, and women like Sabita cannot afford such loans. 

Sabita and her group have requested a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Maa Adishakti Group-B

texts.en:
Maunna, the lady standing in middle in the photo, manages a rented shop where she sells ready-made and other clothing items for adults and children. She has a couple of years' experience in this activity, and is confident of improving the shop's scope and her income, with a little investment. 

An amount of 12,000 INR will help her to stock a far greater variety of clothing items than at present. Since she has understood local preferences and her customers' purchasing power, she will be sourcing more of the fast-moving items from the wholesale market. A good stock will also mean that she does not need to travel to the wholesale market frequently. What's more, customers are happy to buy from her shop as they get easy credit terms, which is an especially attractive feature during the festival season. 

Maunna's enterprise includes door-to-door sales also, with the result that she enjoys good rapport with customers. Enterprising and confident women like Maunna deserve the support of the larger society, as they help in supplementing their husbands' income to give their children a better education and a good life.

Maunna and her group Maa Adishakti Group-B have requested a loan of 36,000 INR. They are thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to stock a far greater variety of clothing items than at present

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juliet is 34 years old, and both children are in school.

Juliet has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Juliet has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 54 years old and widowed with five children. Maria Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Maria Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 35 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Mary Ann has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to  purchase clothes to sell like pants, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell like pants, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedita is 46 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Mercedita has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 31 years old, and all three of her children are in school.

Myrna has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

Myrna has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leah is 40 years old, and her four children are in school.

Leah has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Leah has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Ma. Mercy

texts.en:
Ma. Mercy is 58 years old. She is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Mercy has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Mercy has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Ma. Mercy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Scolastic

texts.en:
Scolastic is 55 years old, hardworking and still strong. She is widowed with four children who are under her care. She is a farmer both growing crops and rearing animals in order to get income to look after her children. 

Scolastic's dream is to have a well educated, happy family. However, she is faced with the challenge of limited capital and weather changes. 

Scolastic is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Group-A

texts.en:
Ashtami, the lady standing first from the right, is 34 and hails from a small village in Sonepur district, Odisha. She works with her husband, and together they run their pottery business. They make pots from soil, ceramic and clay as raw materials. They make instruments like ceramic utensils, plates, jars, etc. The business is run from home, and together they earn 6,000 INR per month. 

This is their first loan which will be utilized for purchasing good quality of clay and soil for pottery. 

Ashtami, along with her group, has requested this loan of 45,000 INR, from which she will use her portion to buy good quality of clay and soil for pottery. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy good quality of clay and soil for pottery

loans.name: St.adolf Bakyara Twezimbe Group

texts.en:
Joseline is a married woman with three children, aged 6, 4 and 2 years, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman who specializes in growing bananas, basically for the local brew. The surplus from the sale of alcohol has helped her to look after the family in acquiring the basic needs. 

Joseline has a dream of building a permanent home as well as educating her children, but her major challenge is drought, which leads to scarcity of raw materials for local brewing. Therefore, Joseline is requesting the loan to buy more  brewing materials like the drum and pipe. 

She is a member of the group of six people as shown in the group photo with the babies of the female members who are too young to be left at home.

loans.use: to buy more  brewing materials like the drum and pipe.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 53-year-old female. She is married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Faith sells fresh tomatoes, onions, cabbages and many other items. She also practices farming to get additional income. 

Faith has a dream of expanding her business and educating her children. However, she is faced with the challenge of market competition. Faith intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes, onions and cabbages for selling.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and cabbages for selling.

loans.name: Posian

texts.en:
Posian is a 45-year-old male. He is married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Posian has operated a general store shop selling at retail prices for eight years now. He also sells crude salt and fresh foods to get additional income. 

Posian has a dream of educating his children and lifting his family to a desired standard of living. However, his problems are limited capital and weather changes. 

Posian wants money to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 43 years old, and both children are in school.

Myrna has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Myrna has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 42-year-old lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells clothes, and at the same time, owns a school that adds more income for her. She is faced with challenges of limited capital and delayed school fees payments that hinder progress of her business. Besides that, she has hopes of expanding her school to new areas. Gladys has asked for a loan to add more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to add more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joackim

texts.en:
Joachim is 42 years old, married, and living in Kasese, Uganda. He has a responsibility of looking after six children, of whom four attend school. He is a teacher by profession, and what matters to him most is seeing his children go to school. Joachim gets additional income from a retail shop of general merchandise, which he began with his little savings. 

Joachim is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios, 54, is a married woman with nine children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Remedios has a carenderia business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking, honest married man with eight children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Joseph owns a depot of beverages and soft drinks to get income and boost his family welfare. He gets additional income from farming, fish mongering and selling coffee. 

Joseph has a dream of building a residential house for his family and having a model depot in his area. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and bricks to construct his residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 33 years old, married, and has five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Samson has sold second-hand clothes since 2006. He began the business in order to have a source of income. 

Samson has a dream of educating his children and expanding his business into a modern boutique with the latest designs. However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital coupled with the unfavorable weather conditions, since he operates in an open place leading to little sales as he struggles to look for shelter. 

Samson wants money to buy second-hand shirts and dresses for selling.

loans.use: to buy second hand shirts and dresses for selling.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Group-B

texts.en:
Jangyaseni, the lady standing first from the right, at 45, has learned to be the head of her household in a small village in Sonepur district of Odisha. While her two older sons work as an electrician and a painter, Jangyaseni has been supplementing the family income by selling milk from the cows that she has owned for the past three years. 

She has now requested a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase another cow and to provide the cow with healthy food and proper shelter. Although illiterate, Jangyaseni has ensured that her third son received some education. She hopes to save enough money for herself and to educate her third son further; he is now in the 12th grade.

Jangyaseni and three other women from the same village have made a group having the name Maa Mahalaxmi Group-B to help and support each other. She and her group have requested 60,000 INR, and she will use her portion to purchase a cow and to provide the cow with healthy food and proper shelter.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to provide the cow with healthy food and proper shelter.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Group-C

texts.en:
Bhumisuta, the lady standing first on the left, is from Hilung village of Sonepur district, Odisha. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and two sons who are currently studying. 

She owns a grocery shop that she has been running from home for the last three years. She says that although she has a good rapport with her customers, the market fluctuations affect the prices of the commodities and this in turn affects her sales and income. 

She requires a loan of 15,000 INR in order to expand her grocery shop. She will will use this amount to buy necessary grocery items like rice, edible oil, condiments, etc. for her shop. We wish her all the best in her business.

Bhumisuta, along with her group, Maa Mahalaxmi Group-C, has requested a loan of 45,000 INR to invest in their respective business activities. The Maa Mahalaxmi Group-C would like to thank Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy necessary grocery items like rice, edible oil, condiments, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old and has two children. Rowena is married and her two children are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sherlyn Ferry

texts.en:
Sherlyn Ferry is 43 years old with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Sherlyn Ferry runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her business like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for eight years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, etc.. 

In the future, Sherlyn Ferry would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her business like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a 33-year-old married woman with four children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Oliver has been operating a general merchandise shop for eight years. She is also an agent of a radio station where she earns a little salary. She has a dream of educating her children and building a strong residential house and her business dream is to have a wholesale shop. Her hardship, however, is weather changes and price fluctuations. 

Oliver needs the loan to buy construction materials such as cement and sand and materials to bring electricity to her residential house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and materials to bring electricity to her residential house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Kasese Uganda. He is 35 years old and married with two children and one dependent who are all going to school. 

Samuel owns a motorcycle transport business along side a piggery and poultry projects in addition to the little salary he earns. He is a hardworking man determined to have a bright future. He has a dream of venturing into a timber business that can fetch him more income. However, market competition and bad roads are his challenges. 

Samuel is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his dependent.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his dependent, who is a diploma student.

loans.name: Zepher

texts.en:
Zepher is 51 years old. He is married and has ten children, nine of whom attend school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

He runs a textile shop and has been in that business for 11 years. He gets additional income from farming. Zepher began the business in order to earn a living and become rich. 

Zepher has a dream of educating his children to university level. However, he is faced with a challenge of market competition and weather changes that lead to drought. 

Zepher is requesting money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Aganatia

texts.en:
Aganatia is 41 years old, married, and has four children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been operating a retail shop of general merchandise for nine years and also selling clothes. He used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. The loan did not do well as his profits did not increase due to high transport costs and rental bills.  

Aganatia is requesting another loan, which he will use to purchase more clothes to sell. His hardships are high rental costs and transport costs. His personal goal is educating his children while his business goal is expanding his business into a new market.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 30-year-old single man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He provides motorcycle transportation services and also does farming to earn more income. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital, which hinders his business growth. He hopes to construct a permanent house and to educate his children to university level. Patrick has asked for a loan to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing green tea and at the same time has a retail shop that adds more income. He is faced with challenges of drought and price fluctuations. Besides this, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Charles has asked for a loan to rent a tea plantation.

loans.use: to rent a tea plantation

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Group-D

texts.en:
Kamala and her husband are engaged in a fruit-selling business to make a living. She wishes to raise a loan for her group having the name Maa Mahalaxmi Group-D to further expand the business and grow their earnings. 

As fruits are always in demand, the couple plan to add more varieties of fruits to their venture, and for maintaining freshness, they buy on a regular basis. They have been doing this activity for the last four years and are well aware of their customers' preferences to make good profit from this venture.

Kamala, along with her group, has requested a loan of 45,000 INR, from which she will use her portion to buy more varieties of fruits to increase sales. Maa Mahalaxmi Group-D is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fruits to increase sales.

loans.name: Neider Yesid

texts.es:
El señor Neider es un hombre emprendedor, estudioso y aplicado, desde hace 1 año comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 

El vive en el municipio de Medellín con su madre a la cual manifiesta que tiene mucho que agradecerle en la vida.

El trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 6:00 Pm atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a granel como frutas, verduras arroz, frijol, lentejas, entre otros y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Neider is an enterprising, studious and dedicated man who one year ago started a vegetable store that up to now has produced good results. He lives in the municipality of Medellín with his mother whom he says he has much to thank in his life. He works Monday to Sunday from 8am until 6 pm taking care of a fairly high number of clients. He is requesting a loan to buy bulk products like fruits, vegetables, rice, beans and lentils, amongst others and in this way satisfy his clients that request these products. This help will allow him to inject variety into his business and bring him the juicy opportunity to improve his sales and his family's income.

loans.use: to buy products in bulk like fruit vegetables, rice, beans, lentils, amongst others.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 55 years old and widowed with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Victoria has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

Victoria has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 36 years old and has one child in school.

Rowena has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, home products, and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, home products, and other groceries

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 37 years old and married with four children. One of her children is in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 4-year-old married, hard working entrepreneur with eight children, five attend school.

Mary Ann has had a water retailing business for 6 years and requests 1,0000 PHP through NWTF to buy more containers of water to sell.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of water to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 38-year old married, hard working entrepreneur with eight children, six attend school.

Melanie has had a food vending business for 2 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy books, pens, and reams of paper for resale and also a computer.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is 32 years old, and married with three children. One goes to school. 

Robert owns a coffee hulling machine, and that's where he has managed to earn a living. He has a dream of constructing a residential house on his plot. However, he is faced with the challenge of the engine breaking down, whereby he has to inject a lot of money in repairing it. 

Robert has asked for a loan to buy an engine for the coffee hulling machine.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the coffee hulling machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing bananas, and at the same time makes bricks that add him more income. 

He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation that affect positive progress of his production. Besides that, he hopes to improve the standard of his residential house by fully furnishing it. 

John needs a loan to improve his residential house by plastering it.

loans.use: to improve his residential house by plastering it.

loans.name: Alfaheny

texts.es:
Alfaheny, de 38 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida al lado de sus tres hijas y su esposo.
Ella se desempeña como confeccionista de distintas prendas en contratación con terceros tales como pijamas, camisetas y ropa interior.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus hijas.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada, siempre en busca de oportunidades para progresar y mejorar como empresaria.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar tela que le permita mejorar su nivel de producción y poder aumentar sus ventas.

De esta forma podría solventar todos sus gastos y podría tener esa vida plena que tanto ha soñado.
texts.en:
Alfaheny is 38 years old. She's very clear on what she wants in her life and is dedicated to getting ahead and having a good live together with her three children and husband.

She works making different garments such as pajamas, shirts and underwear, and contracts with third parties,  She began this activity with a desire to seek the necessary resources to support her daughters.

She's an entrepreneurial woman who's very disciplined, always looking for opportunities to progress and improve herself as a businesswoman. 

She's seeking a loan to buy fabric that will allow her to increase her production level and be able to sell more. In this way, she can pay for all her expenses and have the full life she's dreamed of so much.

loans.use: to buy fabric that will allow her to increase her production level.

loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en:
Bardhok and his wife, Martine, request a loan to buy a dairy cow because they have raised livestock for 2 years. They rent agricultural land to plant feed for the animals because it is less expensive then buying it.
 
“Livestock is a good activity for people in the rural because you get milk and other dairy products for your family. You can sell these homemade products and the young animals. All in al, it is good, but working so hard is difficult as well. Yet, people in the villages have no other choice  but to continue to practice agriculture & raise livestock“,  said Bardhok to the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nurihan

texts.en:
Nurihan is a widowed woman with two children who lives in the city of Korca. 

She has been sick for a long time and seeks your assistance to help her financially with doctor visits and medical expenses. Her disability income is roughly $175/month which  is not enough. Her children provide a little money that they take away from their families to support her.

“I’ve lived most of my life alone, with no husband since he passed away when I had young children and I have struggled,” said Nurihan looking away while she was talking. 

SHe will use  a small portion of the loan  to put some concrete in the terrace that lately has been leaking because it is very old.

loans.use: to pay for medicine, doctor bills, and put concrete on the terrace of her very old home.

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Merasol works hard to support her family of 3 children.

She has a beverage business and earns additional income operating a general store.  Merasol requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy beverages to sell.

Merasol has sustained her business activities through 6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  beverages.

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy, una mujer de 30 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 9 horas.
Buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.

De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.

Apoya a Leidy con su negocio!
texts.en:
Leidy, a 30-year-old woman, has given her entire life in service to her family, trying to get them ahead and together overcoming the obstacles that have come up against them in life.  Thanks to a store that she managed to open with great effort, patience, and sacrifice, she has generated the income needed to support her children.

She works alone each day for nine hours.

Looking to be the best family business in the sector, she wants to ask for a loan to buy merchandise that will allow her to increase her inventory of items such as grains and groceries.

In this way she will go on overcoming difficulties such as low sales and competition.

This loan will be a great opportunity to establish hers as the most productive store in the neighborhood and will give her the chance to make her much longed-for dream come true: buying her own home.

Support Leidy with her business!

loans.use: to buy merchandise, which will allow her to expand her inventory of items such as grains and groceries.

loans.name: Merigilda

texts.en:
Merigilda is a 45-year-old woman with two children who works very hard to provide for them.

Merigilda has run a general store for 15 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Merigilda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a 29-year-old  married woman with four children who works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene has run a general store for 3 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Mylene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly works hard to support her family of 3 children.

She has a fishing business and earns additional income operating a general store. Nelly requests 3,500 PHP through NWTF to  buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Nelly has sustained her business  through  2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a 27-year-old married woman with one child who is a hard working entrepreneur. 

Nerissa has had a clothing  business for 4 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy belts and other items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy belts and other items.

loans.name: Bardhyl

texts.en:
Bardhyl has raised livestock and been in agriculture for over 20 years.  He requests this loan to purchase pesticides and potato seeds.   He’s has two cows and rents land to plant red peppers, onions, leaks, beans, corn, fodder and oats. 

He is 55 years old and has one child.

 Here is what Bardhyl said to the Branch Assistant who interviewed him: 
“What we, the villagers practice is not easy. We have to wake up at 3 am every day, 7 days a week; we milk the cows, clean the stables, take the cows out to breathe a bit of fresh air, make fresh dairy products  such as butter, cheese or cottage cheese. Then, around 6 or 7 am we go to the field; no matter what the weather is. It’s really tiresome and sometimes we can’t sell all the fresh produce and it spoils which causes us to lose money and all the hard labour that goes with it.”

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Nailina

texts.pt:
A senhora Nailina é pensionista e comerciante, tem 65 anos de idade,mãe solteira de 8 filhos todos maiores de idade, 6 dos quais ja vivendo em suas próprias casas.Alem dos filhos sustenta 2 netos, mas não vivem com eles, tem própria casa. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar um jogo de sofás e uma cristaleira para confortar a sua família.
Seus projectos futuros e melhorar sua vida e ter uma viatura para ajudar  na deslocação para a sua machamba.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz poupança e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Nailina is a pensioner and saleswoman. She is 65 years old, single, and the mother of eight adult children, of whom six live in their own homes. In addition to her children, she also supports two grandchildren who live elsewhere. She lives in her own home. She says that with this loan she will buy a sofa set and a display cabinet to make her family more comfortable. Her future projects are to improve her life and to have a car to make it easier for her to get to her small plot of cropland. She tells us that her main challenge is a lack of funds and that to deal with this she maintains a savings account and will also take out future loans to pursue her plan.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar algunas herramientas que le hacen falta para continuar con su impecable labor de mecánico.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a very experienced car and motorcycle mechanic.  He has gained a lot of skills by learning them hands-on.

He is a very hardworking and honest man who knows the importance that cars have for their owners, and it is because of this that he always tries to offer excellent service—high quality and in an efficient manner.

He is asking for a loan to buy some tools that he is missing in order to continue his impeccable work as a mechanic.

loans.use: to buy some tools he is missing.

(NWTF) to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Nimfa has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from coconut wine-vending.

Nimfa aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

Orley, tiene una venta de aserrín desde hace 4 años y lo aprendió por medio de su hermano, quien también es comerciante

Orley, necesita el crédito para cercar el lote donde alberga y obtiene su producto, además de arreglar el techo de este espacio para seguir trabajando en este negocio, de esta manera mejorara su vida, ya que tendrá más ingresos para ella y su familia. 

Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca y que en un futuro la pueda mejorar y que genere más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Orley, age 35, is in a relationship.  Her partner is a merchant, and she has four daughters, who are in school.

Orley has been selling sawdust for four years.  She learned to do this from her brother, who is also a merchant.

Orley needs this loan to enclose the lot where her product is kept and processed.  She also needs to fix the roof of this space in order to keep working in her business.  In this way she will improve her life, because she will have more income for herself and her family.

She dreams that her business will grow, and that in the future she can improve it, and it will generate more income for her family.
