loans.name: By Pass School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Willy. He is the Head teacher at By Pass Standard Primary School a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kawempe, Kampala District with 500 students. By Pass Standard School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra filtration water system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra filtration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

By Pass Standard School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Willy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Adan Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Adan de 44 años, es soltero, desde hace 1 año tiene una salsamentaria la cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Tiene como sueño ampliar su negocio donde distribuye artículos como licor, comestibles, entre otros.

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Adan, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como frituras y licor para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de él.
texts.en: Adan is 44 years old, single and one year ago opened a deli which he takes care of with much effort and dedication. His dream is to expand his business where he sells articles like liquors and food amongst others. Currently he has little variety and this is detrimental to him as he can't supply many products that his clients ask for. Given this, Adan has decided to request a loan with the goal of organizing more and buy the stock needed wholesale like fried foods and liquors to increase his offerings and offer better service to people. This will also represent an increase in his income to cover the basic needs of all businesses like utilities, taxes and others, plus increasing his well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale like fried foods and liquor to increase what he offers.

Victor’s Junior Christian School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water-treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Victor’s Junior Christian School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Gabriel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

This loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kamuli Mixed Happy Hours Primary School will repay their loan from the school fees collected each term. Deo ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by both reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Lisley

texts.en:
Lisley is a woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lisley is 23 years old and has one child in school.

Lisley has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more nipa leaves to use in her business.

Lisley has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa leaves to use in her business.

loans.name: Lux Charmaine

texts.en:
Lux Charmaine is 35 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lux Charmaine is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lux Charmaine has been in this business for three years, and she also earns income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felicidad is 43 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Felicidad has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks to use for her business.

Felicidad has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks to use for her business

loans.name: Crispina

Crispina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Crispina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, rice, home product care and other groceries.

Celsa has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Celsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, rice, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her business.

loans.name: Evangelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con su familia en una humilde finca en zona rural de Monteria. 

Ella es madre responsable durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.

Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a country woman with perseverance and drive. She lives with her family in a humble farm in a rural area of Monteria. She is a responsible mother who through all this time has had the courage and bravery to raise her children with her own means.She earns her living raising and producing pigs. She has run this business for 3 years with the goal of having sufficient resources to maintain her family. She works every day as the pigs require cleaning, food and constant monitoring for their proper development and posterior sale.

She is requesting the loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed and fodder for her animals to give her the opportunity to have better fed animals and in better condition for sale. She dreams of seeing her children as professionals and with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed for her animals.

loans.name: Dayoro

texts.fr: Dayoro est une femme mariée et âgée de 42 ans qui vit à Ségbé. Dayoro vit avec ses deux enfants et s’évertue activement pour gagner un revenu et subvenir à leurs besoins quotidiens. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Dayoro vend des noix de coco qu’elle expose à ses clients qui lui procurent une bonne rentabilité dans son activité. Dayoro s’approvisionne à dans le quartier pour acheter les noix. Grâce  à son dynamisme, Dayoro sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de noix de coco afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire
texts.en: Dayoro is a married woman, aged 42, who lives in Ségbé with her two children and who actively strives to earn an income to meet their day-to-day needs. To this end, she sells coconuts, which she displays to customers and which bring in a good profit in her business. She gets her supplies of coconuts in the district. Thanks to her dynamism, Dayoro is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of coconuts to respond favorably to the expectations of her customer and to have a good profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase 75 sacks of coconuts

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 58 years old and married with one child.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Fely has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Fely aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans et mariée, Afi est une femme qui habite à Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants. Restauratrice, Afi vend du riz préparé dans son quartier pour satisfaire agréablement le goût de ses consommateurs. Cette activité permet à Afi d’avoir une bonne épargne pour investir la vie éducative de ses enfants. Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et demande pour commander des sacs de riz. Grâce au bénéfice, Afi souhaite améliorer ses prestations et bien s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi, aged 46, is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her four children. A restauranteur, she sells cooked rice in her neighborhood to satisfy the tastes of her customers. This business enables her to save some money in order to invest in her children’s educational life. She gets her supplies once a month at the market and is asking [for this loan] to order sacks of rice. Thanks to the profits, Afi would like to improve her offerings and to do well in caring for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of rice

loans.name: Nazirbi

texts.ru: Назирби 55 лет. Она сейчас живет с детьми в районе Чиликул. Старший сын женат, имеет двоих детей.  Он находится на заработках в Российской Федерации после смерти отца. Он зарабатывает и помогает маме обеспечить семью.  Младшие сыновья работают на районе. Сама Назирби занимается выращиванием скота. Она покупает скота и откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает на скотном рынке. Назирби 39 лет продвигает эту деятельность. Ей в работе помогает сыновья. Она хочет купить скота, чтобы продвигаться дальше, но у Назирби нет денег. Поэтому она берет кредит. Помогите ее  финансовыми трудностями. Назирби и ее семья заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Nazirbi is 55 and lives with her children in the Jilikul region. Her oldest son is married with two children and has been working in Russia since his father died. He earns money to help his mother take care of the family. Her younger sons work locally, while Nazirbi herself raises livestock. She purchases cattle, fattens them and sells them at the market a few months later. She has been working in this field for 39 years, now with the help of her sons. 

Nazirbi wants to buy livestock in order to move her business forward but she doesn't have enough money. Therefore she is taking out a loan. Please help her through these financial difficulties. She and her family thank you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock to continue her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 54 years old and has three children. 

Delia is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and her rice mill laborers' salaries.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and her rice mill laborers' salaries

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 30 years old and a married woman with one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenny has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries like soap, noodles, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

Jenny has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jenny would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soap, noodles, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is 37 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Catherine has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks.

Catherine has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks to use in her roofing business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 50 years old now.

Judith has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 32 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Jona earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. She has been farming vegetables for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jona is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the salaries of the laborers at her rice mill.

Josefina has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is 31 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Laarni works very hard to provide for them.

Laarni runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Laarni would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is married and the mother of four children. She is 60 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur who runs a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 from NWTF to buy more ingredients to use when making food to sell. Juanita has been in this business for two years and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a 26-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jovelyn has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more nipa leaves and bamboo stick to use in her business. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa leaves and bamboo stick to use in her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 27-year-old, married woman with one kid in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Marites has a business selling balut and peanut in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more balut and peanut to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for twenty years. 

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more balut to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with one child, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 25 years old now.

Janice has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more nipa leaves, bamboo stick and other supplies to use in her business. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more nipa leaves, bamboo stick and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 54 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling snacks in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more snacks to sell. Rosemarie has been in this line of work for five years and her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack-selling business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 56 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan from NWTF to buy more produce to sell in her food stall. Judith has been in this business for ten years and her goals for the future are to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Adzo est âgée de 33 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Pour aider sa famille à avoir un bon cadre de vie, Adzo vend du gari dans le quartier et en se promenant dans les marchés afin d’avoir le revenu nécessaire. Pour bien vendre sa marchandise, Adzo s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché. Adzo veut mieux réaliser ses ventes pour bien satisfaire ses clients et demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de gari. Adzo désire augmenter son épargne et pourvoir considérablement aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Adzo is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She is 33 years old and the mother of four. To help out her family for a good quality of life, she sells gari [cassava couscous] in her district by going from place to place at the markets in order to make the necessary income. To do well in her sales, Adzo gets her supplies once a month at the market. She wants to carry out her work better in order to satisfy her customers well and is asking for this loan to purchase sacks of gari. Adzo would like to increase her savings and really be able to meet the family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of gari

loans.name: Hermin

texts.en: As the married mother of four children, Hermin works hard to support her family by running a restaurant in the Philippines. She earns additional income by farming sugarcane and has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 from NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant. Hermin has sustained her business activities with help from four prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans et mère de cinq enfants. Yawa vit  à Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Yawa vend des paniers tressés dans le quartier et les marchés. Yawa s’approvisionne une fois par mois. Yawa demande ce crédit pour commander les paniers afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Yawa désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en: Yawa is a married woman, 41 years old, and the mother of five. She lives in Adidogomé to run her business. She sells woven baskets in her district and at the markets. She gets her supplies once a month. Yawa is asking for this loan for ordering the baskets, so as to do well in her sales and to have more profit. She would like to make a profit to support her husband in covering family expenses and to allow her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 13 dozen woven baskets

loans.name: Mukabatkon

texts.ru: Мукабаткон 44 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Мукабаткон среднее образование, с 1995 года она занимается животноводством, выращиванием и реализацией сельхозкультур. В хозяйстве есть 8 коров. На участке мерою 1,0 Га, она выращивает подсолнечник и рис. Вся семья с радостью помогает Мукабаткон в ведении ее бизнеса. Так как вся продукция экологичная, она пользуется большим спросом и число покупателей растет с каждым днем. Мукабаткон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и подготовку почвы для весенне-полевых работ. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Mukabatkon is 44 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. Mukabatkon has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and growing and selling agricultural crops since 1995. She has 8 cows on her farm and grows sunflowers and rice on approximately 1.0 hectare of land. Her whole family gladly helps Mukabatkon to run the business. Because all of her products are organic, they are in high demand, and the number of her customers grows every day. Mukabatkon requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows and to prepare the land for the spring field work. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy cows and to prepare the land for the spring field work

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 22 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elvie has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Llapanchis Llankasun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHIS LLANKASUN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de 
Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria ella es casada y tiene 55 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva mandarinas,cafe,platanos y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Llapanchis Llankasun”. This bank is located in the District of Echarate in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Maria. She is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Maria works at her business of cultivating fruit. She has a plot of land where she grows tangerines, coffee, bananas, and oranges. Maria works from 6:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in this line of work for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her farmland. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members sell animals, work in agriculture, manage a grocery store, and sell food.

Maria is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат жительница района Чиликул. Ей всего 22 лет. Она замужем и мать одного ребенка. Саломат правильная и ответственная женщина. Ее муж в районе работает председателем сельскохозяйственной культуры. Саломат 2 года назад начала заниматься животноводством. Ей это работа нравиться. Она идет по стопам дедушки. Саломат ухаживает за животными у себя во дворе. Ей в работе помогает муж. Ее главная цель купить 3 голов мелко рогатого скота и увеличить поголовье. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она берет кредит. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Salomat is a resident of the Jilikul district. She is only 22 years old, married and a mother of one child. Salomat is righteous and responsible woman. Her husband works as a district chairman for agricultural culture. Salomat got involved in animal husbandry 2 years ago and likes this work. She is following her grandfather's footsteps. Salomat takes care of livestock in her yard. Her husband helps her with the work. Salomat's main goal is to buy 3 heads of small livestock and increase its headcount. She is requesting a loan due to a shortage in money. The requested loan will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy 3 heads of small livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa is 59 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Delsa has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to resell.

Delsa has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 38 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Cecile earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cecile has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Josephine operates a rice retailing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Josephine requested a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Danahon

texts.ru: Данахон, 53 года, замужем, мать 5 детей, самому младшему - 10 лет. Образование-среднее, с 1993 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Данахон, на сегодняшний день она имеет 2 коровы. А на участке мерою 0,49 Га выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль Данахон составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Данахон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Данахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса, что позволит ей накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Danahon is 53 years old, married and a mother of 5 children, the youngest of whom is 10 years old. She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1993. Thanks to Danahon's hard work and patient character, she currently has 2 cows and 0.49 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes. Danahon's monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, Danahon requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls for fattening up and resale. Danahon plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business, which will allow her to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a 52-year-old married woman with nine children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Miguela has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Miguela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, de 28 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y muy trabajador, desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura, por medio de este trabajo obtiene ingresos para él y su familia. 

Miguel, alquila una parcela de tierra para sembrar maíz y maicillo.
 
Miguel, con el crédito comprará los insumos para ir preparando la tierra en donde va a sembrar este próximo año.

Sus sueños a futuro son, comprar un local a la orilla de la carretera, para colocar un taller de reparación de bicicletas.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 28, is an enterprising and hardworking man. He has worked in agriculture for several years, which allows him to generate income for himself and his family. Miguel rents a parcel of land on which he plants corn and sorghum.

With this loan, Miguel will buy supplies so that he can prepare his land for planting this upcoming year. His dream for the future is to buy a place on the side of the road where he can open a bicycle repair shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies so that he can prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Rodis Adolfo

texts.es:
Rodis, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos, su negocio es la venta de madera.
Él es buen padre, independiente, paciente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. 

Su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de Lorica. De clima generalmente seco con una temperatura alta. 

Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se ocupa del hogar y con sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar, viven en una casa de la familia. 

El se encarga de vender madera para las carpinterías. 

La ventaja de su negocio es la comodidad de su taller amplio y bien ubicado, la desventaja es cuando recibe pedidos contrata ayudantes y estos no son constantes. 

Su sueño es tener una gran comercializadora de madera conocido, él desea realizar la compra de gran cantidad de madera. 

Es por esos motivos que Rodis solicita un préstamo.
texts.en:
Rodis lives with his wife, has five children, and a business that sells wood.  He is a good father, independent, patient, persevering, active, responsible and hardworking.  He runs his business in the Lorica municipality, which has an overall dry and hot climate.  He shares his life with his wife, who looks after the home, and with his children, who are not yet school aged.  They live in a house belonging to the family.

He is in charge of selling wood for carpentry work.  The advantage of his business is the convenience of his extensive, well-located workshop.  The disadvantage is when he receives orders, hires assistants and they are not consistent.  His dream is to own a great, well-known wood trading company.  Rodis is requesting a loan because he wants to purchase a large amount of wood.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of wood

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Afi est une femme mariée avec un enfant à sa charge. Afi habite à Adidogomé et cherche vigoureusement à améliorer leur condition de vie en vendant des produits cosmétiques. Afi vend ses produits dans un atelier de son quartier et se déplace à la demande de ses clients. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché afin de trouver une bonne rentabilité. Afi demande ce crédit pour acheter des pommades de beauté de  bonnes qualités répondant aux goûts de ses clients. Afi souhaite augmenter son profit et contribuer favorablement aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Afi, aged 34, is a married woman with one child to support and lives in Adidogomé. She strives to improve their living conditions by selling cosmetic products. She sells her products at a shop in her neighborhood and makes trips according to customer requests. Afi gets her supplies twice a month at the market to make a good profit. She is asking for this loan to purchase some good quality beauty ointments that satisfy the wishes of her customers. She would like to increase her profit and help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ointments

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 29 years old and married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mercedita has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 66 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Rebecca operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 14 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Rebecca requested her seventeenth loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items such as rice, soft drinks, detergent, and  school supplies. She hopes save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, detergent, and school supplies.

loans.name: Ameliza

texts.en:
Ameliza is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ameliza is 41 years old and four of her children are in school.

Ameliza has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more materials needed for her business.

Ameliza has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Amorsula

texts.en: Amorsula, 38 years old, is married and has five children, four of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 2 years, Amorsula has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other needed materials. In the future, Amorsula would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other needed materials

loans.name: Angerita

texts.en: Angerita, 28 years old, is married and has two children, one of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year, Angerita has operated a seaweed business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her business. In the future, Angerita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her seaweed production business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita, 48 years old, is married and has six children, three of them in school. Carmelita works very hard to provide for them. For the past 15 years, Carmelita has run a general store in the Philippines. selling a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 39 years old and has one child.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emma has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 71 years old, widowed, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Erlinda requested her twenty second loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lugie

texts.en:
Lugie is 31 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Lugie runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as sardines, soft drinks, eggs, and other groceries. 

Lugie requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Omara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Omara es una mujer fuerte, trabajadora y responsable; que se esfuerzan día a día, junto a su esposo, por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Razón que la llevó a vender ropa en uno de los mercados del país, para apoyar con los gastos económicos de su hogar y cubrir las necesidades de sus vástagos.  
Por ello, solicita el crédito para la compra de nueva mercadería como pantalones, camisas, ropa interior. Lo cual le servirá  de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y así atraerá más clientes, en consiguiente sus ingresos económicos aumentaran.
texts.en:
Omara is a strong, hardworking, and responsible woman who strives each day with her husband to help their children move forward. For this reason, she sells clothes at one of the national markets so that she can contribute to the household expenses and also cover the needs of her children.

Omara is requesting a loan in order to buy new merchandise such as trousers, shirts, and undergarments. This will enable her to offer a wider variety of products so that she can attract more customers. As a result, her earnings will increase.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise such as trousers, shirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru: Калбубу, 50 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Калбубу среднее образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с покупки овец. У нее в хозяйстве участок мерою 1,33 ГА собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, где она выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kalbubu is 50 years old, married and has three children. Kalbubu has secondary education. She has worked with farming for many years, after having started this business with the purchase of a sheep. She has her own plot of land of 1.33 hectares and 1.0 hectares of rented land on her farm, where she grows potatoes. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kalbubu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase ten sheep. She plans to direct the income from the loan towards developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep for fattening up and subsequently reselling them

loans.name: Marknao Group

texts.en: Phonechai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Phonechai and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Phonechai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two-year period, filter users, like Phonechai’s family, will notice a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Jairo con un gran espíritu trabajador y aventurero, se dedica a la cria de peces desde hace 19 años con una meta fija que es la de poder salir adelante y poder construir junto a su familia un buen futuro.
Es padre responsable de 4 hijos menores de edad a los cuales siempre ha procurado ofrecerles la mejor educación que le sea posible.
Trabaja todos los días en su negocio durante jornadas de 12 horas en busca de una buena produccion.
Solicita un préstamo para la adecuación de sus estanques y para la compra de alimento para sus peces y mejorar las condiciones de su trabajo.
Estos elementos le permitirán trabajar más cómodamente y tendrá una mejor producción.
Ayuda a un humilde pescador de las tierras colombianas con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Jairo, instilled with a hard-working and adventurous spirit, has been making a living through fish farming over the past 19 years with a set goal in mind: to be able to get ahead and, together with his family, build a good future.

He is a responsible father of four underage children, for whom he has always striven to provide the best education he possibly can.

He works in his business 12 hours every day, aiming to obtain a good fish production.

He is requesting a loan to improve his fishponds, to buy feed for his fishes, and to improve his working conditions.

These improvements will allow him to work more comfortably and have a better production.

Help this humble Colombian fish farmer with a loan!

loans.use: to improve his fishponds and buy feed for his fishes.

loans.name: Erika Beatriz

texts.es:
Erika, junto a su esposo ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo.

Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos.

Es una mujer soñadora y con gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.

Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Erika, along with her husband, has been able to make a very strong, productive family, not just because they are loving, but also because they have the desire to move forward in life and progress as a family.  She makes a living raising and selling young pigs and chickens.  She learned this profession from her husband, who currently makes a living in this area and has been the main source of income for a long time.

She is requesting economic assistance to buy some young pigs to raise and to later sell.  She is a woman with dreams and great determination, so much that she is already thinking big and wants to have a high capacity farm.  She is very excited and has many expectations for this project and trusts in the kind-hearted Kiva lenders to help her grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy some young pigs to raise

loans.name: Urkupina Group

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 6 hijos de 15, 12, 10, 7, 5 años y un bebé de 3 meses, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘Los Chacos’ perteneciente a la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área rural caracterizada por agrupar a productores manufactureros en todas las áreas y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de repartir esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente  aproximadamente 22-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Margarita es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada en la primera silla de la derecha, sostiene a su bebé). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su deseo por ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas, la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de desayunos, venta de comida, elaboración de helados, venta de refrescos, venta de fruta, venta de horneados tradicionales, venta de chinelas, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de artículos de limpieza, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional; ella se encarga de comprar carnes, verduras y otros para cocinar comidas como; locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte “taitetú” frito), majao encapao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante empujando un carrito de 2 ruedas cargado de ollas llenas de comida, hasta encontrar un lugar con sombra para sacar unos banquitos para sentarse y abrir su puesto de venta. “busco a mis clientes a diario, tengo zonas donde me acerco y realizo la venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes le aconsejaron que habrá un puesto de venta fijo para acudir a ella constantemente, la desventaja es que no cuenta con el mobiliario necesario. Su sueño es tener un restaurante dónde pueda vender comida en mayor cantidad, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para su nuevo puesto de venta fijo para mejorar su atención al cliente y generar mejores ventas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos en la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Margarita solicita un préstamo para la compra de mobiliario para su puesto de venta fijo de comida para atender a sus clientes constantes.
texts.en:
31-year old Margarita lives with her partner and six children aged 15, 12, 10, 6, 5 and a 3 month-old baby. She earns her living selling traditional food.

Margarita is a good mother, enterprising, independent, friendly, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business in the Los Chacos neighbourhood of the Plan 3000 area. It’s a rural area known for its groups of all kinds of manufacturers and wholesale distributors who deliver their products to the different markets of the town. The climate is tropical and very wet, with a temperature range of 22-35C throughout the year.

Margarita is dark complexioned with long black hair that she wears tied back. She has brown eyes and is of small stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, and she also speaks Spanish for cultural and business purposes. In the photo she is sitting on the first seat on the right and is holding her baby. Her partner works in construction. They live in their own house built of bricks with a corrugated metal roof. They have electricity and get their water from a well.

Margarita’s wish to expand her business and improve sales led her to form a communal bank of business owners. The members of the group have business such as selling breakfasts, selling food, making ice cream, selling soft drinks, selling fruit, selling traditional baked food, selling flip flops, selling secondhand clothes, and selling cleaning products. They wish to obtain a loan and make their businesses more prosperous. 

Margarita sells traditional food. She uses meat, vegetables, and other items in the dishes she makes such as locro carretero cruceño (soup made from dried meat cut into pieces, yucca and egg), chicharrón de taitetu (fried wild pork), majao encapao (minced dried meat, boiled bananas, and rice), locotos rellenos (peppers stuffed with meat and onions) etc. She sells the dishes in the streets every day of the week pushing a 2-wheeled cart holding the pans full of food until she finds a shady spot with seats. Then she starts selling the food.

She goes to certain areas where she finds her customers and makes her sales. The advantage of her business is that her regular customers seek her out; the disadvantage is that she doesn’t have tables and chairs. Margarita’s dream is to have a restaurant where she can sell larger quantities of food. She wishes to buy tables and chairs for her new fixed premises and improve the service she offers her customers. Then she will increase sales. This is Margarita’s second loan cycle in the four years she has been running her business. She is seeking a loan to buy tables and chairs so she can better look after her regular customers.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for the regular customers at her food stall

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is 47 years old and married. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ma. Flor requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items such as biscuits, soft drinks, soap, and other groceries. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, soft drinks, soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Eliezer Antonio

texts.es:
Eliezer, tiene una venta de artículos plásticos, inicio a vender ropa con ahorros que él tenía y con ayuda de su familia, tiene 3 años de haberse independizado y posteriormente a incluido nuevos productos, vive en una casa familiar junto a sus padres y hermanos, tiene dos hijos pero no viven con él, sin embargo es un padre responsable y mes a mes les está ayudando económicamente.
Invertirá en juguetes al por mayor pagando por ellos un bajo precio, así los ofrecer a un valor accesible para sus clientes y también le dejara un buen margen de ganancias, cabe mencionar que su negocio está ubicado en una zona mucho comercio.
Sus aspiraciones son ir introduciendo nuevos productos en su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y tener su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Eliezer has a plastic items store. He started by selling clothing with savings that he had and with the help of his family.  He has been independent for three years and has since included new products. He lives in a family home with his parents and siblings. He has two children but they do not live with him. However, he is a responsible father and is helping them financially month-to-month.  

He will invest in toys wholesale, paying a low price for them in order to offer an affordable price for his customers and also leaving him a good profit margin. It is worth mentioning that his business is located in an area with a lot of commerce. His aspirations are to introduce new products into his business to satisfy the needs of his customers and to have a source of income.

loans.use: to invest in toys wholesale, paying a low price for them in order to offer an affordable price for his customers and also to leave him a good profit margin

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, 57 years old, is married and has four children, one in school. For the past 4 years, Dolores has been farming rice and corn in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dolores has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, 51 years old, is married and has six children, one in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Editha has operated a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as soap, etc. to sell. In the future, Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Khamfalaeng Group

texts.en: Vongphachan is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Vongphachan and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Vongphachan and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Vongphachan and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Vongphachan and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will provide for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Chaloum Group

texts.en: Van’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Van and her group are excited that a filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now can shift to other pursuits. Van and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, within which filter users, like Van’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sonunbu

texts.ru: Сонунбу 45 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Сонунбу - среднее образование, более 10 лет в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сонунбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 2 лошади, а также земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где она выращивает подсолнечник для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Сонунбу составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития и расширения бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку коров, в среднем за 25,000 - 30,000 сом (KGS) каждую для откорма и реализации. Доходы от ведения бизнеса, она будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Sonunbu is 45 years old, married and has two children. Sonunbu has secondary education. To get an additional source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for more than 10 years. Thanks to Sonunbu's persistent work, her farm currently has four cows, two horses and also a plot of land of 2.0 hectares, where she grows sunflowers for selling. Sonunbu's income is 25,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop and expand her business, Sonunbu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS). She will use it to purchase cows at an average price of 25,000-30,000 som (KGS) each, to breed and then resell. She will direct the income from the business into further developing it.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows for fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Phonnadeetai Group

texts.en: Thongchan is excited the water filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Thongchan and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Thongchan and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Thongchan and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thongchan and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nelis Maria

texts.es:
Nelis es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace unos meses cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 47 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller; trabaja todos los días; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina de confección y tela para cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Nelis sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelis is a dedicated and hardworking microentrepreneur.  Her field of work is dressmaking and she provides her work to third parties.  This all started a few months ago when she worked in a tailoring workshop.  Today, at 47 years of age, she now has her own workshop and works every day.  In this way, she generates the necessary resources to help her husband with the home expenses.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase a sewing machine and fabric in order to fulfill the requests of her clients and to deliver the orders in a timely manner.  This way, she can increase her production and acquire new contracts that will allow her to continue with her microbusiness.  Nelis has dreams to continue strengthening her workshop and to have a higher production level every day in order to generate new employment opportunities and to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric to fulfill the requests of her clients

loans.name: Phonnadeeneua Group

texts.en: Pasert’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Pasert and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Pasert and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years filter users, like Pasert’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonhom Group

texts.en: Saysamone understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Saysamone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Saysamone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Saysamone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Emprendedoras” y está conformada por 10 mujeres trabajadoras. Zulema de 33 años de edad  separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella trabaja como enfermera en un hospital. Hace más de 10 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho trabajo. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su casa. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos para que pueda construir su casa. El grupo “Las Emprendedoras” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva que hicieron posible éste crédito. Zulema se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo  y viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
This is the group "Las Emprendedoras" and it is composed of 10 working women.  

Zulema is 33 years old, separated, and has one dependent child. She works as a nurse in a hospital.  She has been working for over 10 years at this job.  Her greatest desire is to finish building her house. She has requested a loan for the purchase of cement and bricks so that she can build her house.  

The group "Las Emprendedoras" is grateful to the Kiva investors who made this loan possible. Zulema can be found standing in the back, second from the left, wearing a light blue shirt.

loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Cfjdt 20 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 20 est un sous groupe affilié à la Convergence des Femmes et Jeunes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 5 femmes et 1 homme qui habitent dans le même village de Tassette. Ils se réunissent chaque fin de mois pour organiser des tontines et poser des plans stratégiques pour lutter contre la pauvreté. Madame Anna est la présidente, c'est une femme mariée et mère de famille. On la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle évolue dans le commerce de bétail. Elle demande ce crédit pour aller dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour y acheter des moutons et des chèvres qu'elle engraisse et les vendre plus tard. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle souhaite augmenter son périmètre agricole pour y pouvoir exploiter son élevage et diversifier ses produits. De ce fait elle pourra augmenter son épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: CFJDT 20 is a subgroup affiliated with the Convergence of Women and Youth for the Development of Tassette. It is composed of five women and one man, who live in the same village of Tassette. They meet at the end of every month to organize savings groups and put in place strategic plans for the fight against poverty. Mrs. Anna is the president; she is a married mother. In the photo, she has her hand raised. She is advancing in selling livestock. She is asking for this loan to go to the weekly markets to buy sheep and goats, which she fattens and resells later. She has more than 5 years of experience doing this. She begins her day at 7am and finishes at 7pm. She hopes to augment her agricultural land to be able to take advantage of her growing farm and to diversify her products. From this, she will be able to increase her savings and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise and then resell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 39 years old and married with three children who are all currently in school. For the past ten years she has had a sar-sari, or general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Roselyn has borrowed and successfully repaid 21 prior loans from NWTF. She has now requested a 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional groceries to sell.

Roselyn is working hard to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lienxai Group

texts.en: Lamphone is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Lamphone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Lamphone and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Lamphone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Lamphone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pungho Group

texts.en: Vaeng’s village sources much of the drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Vaeng and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits. Vaeng and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years, and, during these two years, filter users, such as Vaeng’s family, experience a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thampha Group

texts.en: Pone understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Pone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Pone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and by decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Pone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule. The filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Xaibuathong Group

texts.en: Say understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Say knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption; this process consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Say purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal, as well as decrease the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Say is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for two years so that she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona, a 46-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school, works hard to provide for her family. For three years she has been running a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Chona, who has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 12000 to purchase more items such as snack food, sardines, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Chona aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, sardines, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, 71 years old, is married and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 15 years, Salvacion has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Salvacion has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Salvacion has previously borrowed and repaid 35 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sathoung Group

texts.en: Thid understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, a task which consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Thid purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal. It will also decrease the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Thid is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that it is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hangxeung Group

texts.en:
Kok and her 17-member group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totaling up the costs, the group recognized the substantial financial savings TerraClear water filters would have for members and their families.

The water filters the group purchased cost approximately 605,294 LAK each for a total of 10,290,000 LAK. They are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years. Kok is especially excited the filter is available on an affordable payment plan. Each group member will now have clean, disease-free water for her or his family.

loans.use: and her group to buy water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Don Group

texts.en:
Chanmee understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Chanmee purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent to buy charcoal or the time and cost incurred in foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Chanmee is excited that the filter is guaranteed for two years and was purchased on an affordable payment schedule. She and her group can therefore continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes and traditional dogon  fabric.

loans.name: Walter Matias

texts.es:
Walter, un hombre de 56 años de edad llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Chinu y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  

Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 4 hijos.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 3 años con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Walter!
texts.en:
Walter, aged 56, has a life full of dreams and aspirations. He lives on a farm in the municipality of Chinu and makes a living through the production and sale of chickens and eggs.

With this occupation, he tries to support his family, which consists of his wife and four children.

He has been following this occupation for the past three years or so in order to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for his chicken coop.

With this loan, he will be able to have a stronger and more sustainable business.

With a loan you make today, you can improve Walter's life and business!

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for his chicken coop.

loans.name: Phonxaitai Group

texts.en:
Khampong’s village has relied for much of their drinking water on local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, but Khampong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water can have on their family’s health and budgets.

Khampong and her 20-member group have now purchased a TerraClear water filter for each member at a cost of 12,250,000 LAK, or 612,500 LAK each. The filters are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years. The group was excited that the filters were available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

Khampong’s family will now realize a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. She will also be able to shift to other pursuits.

loans.use: and their group to buy TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Burbuqe

texts.en:
Burbuqe or “Bud” in English, is 48 years old and a married mother of three young children. They live in a village that is situated almost on top of a mountain where it snows a lot. The terrain is beautiful and quiet, and there is a river running through the village, but there is not much to pursue here.

“My husband is a night guard and gets paid roughly $195 a month for staying up all night seven days a week,” said Burbuqe to the loan officer. “But his salary is not enough for our family, and it’s hard because we are extremely poor. It upsets me very much to see my kids’ faces sad, too.”

So Burbuqe is applying for a 100,000 ALL loan through VisionFund Albania to buy a dairy cow. “I need dairy for my children, but we have little money to buy it. So we thought of getting a loan to invest in a cow.”

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for her children

loans.name: Talwendpanga Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Talwendpanga est formé de 2 femmes battantes. Marcelline est la responsable du groupe; elle est marié et mère de 3 enfants dont 1 est scolarisé. Cette brave dame a pour activité, la vente de l'eau glacée, du jus de gimgimbre et du bissap. Cela fait 6 ans déjà qu'elle exerce cette activité. Au Burkina, il fait actuellement chaud dont ce prêt sera beaucoup utile à Marcelline pour qu'elle puisse offrir ses service à sa clientèle.
