texts.en: Genie is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative (PMPC). Genie hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more production.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Jenon

texts.en:
Jenon is engaged in running a retail store. She has been operating her business for seven years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP.

Jenon is 63 years old, married, and has four children. She is from the village of Poblacion, Sindanagan.

In 2012, Jenon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. Jenon has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. The previous loan was used for personal purposes.

Now, Jenon is requesting her fifth loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store for retail.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store for retail.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is managing her food vending business in Ozamiz City, Philippines. She has mastered this business for more than 10 years, and has been doing well supporting her needs. Milagrosa has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Eleonor has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall. Eleonor has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 46 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, sardines, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Carmen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Jeane runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jeane has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dedita

texts.en:
Dedita is 50 years old and married with five children. She raises pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Dedita has been doing this for three years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking mother who was always been out in the streets to sell food snacks like puto, cheese, and rice cakes for some money. She is very diligent, and she works hard for the betterment of her family.  She is a widow from Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Rosalina has applied her membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. She is in need of additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto, cheese, and rice cakes, because she wants to display her food snacks in every canteen and eatery in the area to generate more income. 

She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 4,000 and is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand and build a good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her family with a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to increase production of the food snacks that she makes and sells.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Hog raising has been Nancy's business involvement. She is a widow and has six children. Nancy aims for a better way of living and a stable source of income. To realize her dreams, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to use to buy two piglets and feed for their daily maintenance. She believes that through proper nourishment of her hogs, she can keep them healthier, and upon reaching their optimum growth, sell them for a greater price. Nancy would be thankful if she can obtain her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Santos Danilo

texts.es: El señor Santos nació en la ciudad de Jinotega, estudio primaria y secundaria, luego le ayudaba al padre a trabajar en labores de agricultura y siembra de café. Actualmente esta casado y tiene 2 hijas, trabaja en labores de agricultura en terreno que le dio el padre además tiene sembrado café y siembra granos básicos. En el sector de la comunidad donde él vive no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder compra el sistema el cual será de gran beneficio para todos los miembros del hogar, estaría muy agradecido si le dan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Santos was born in the city of Jinotega.  He went to elementary and high school, and then he helped his father with the farm work and coffee crop.  He is currently married and has two daughters.  He does farm work on land that his father gave him.  He also has planted coffee and basic grains.

In the area of the community where he lives there is no electricity.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy a solar system.  This way he will be able to buy the system, which will be a great benefit to all of the members of his household.  He would be very grateful if you give him the opportunity of this loan to buy a solar system.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi vit à Vakpossito et est âgée de 50 ans. Mariée, Akouvi est mère de deux enfants et travaille activement pour favoriser leur éducation. Akouvi vend des petits poissons dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu de subsistance. Akouvi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers de poissons, Akouvi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en: Akouvi is 50 years old and lives in Vakpossito. Akouvi is a mother to two children and actively works to foster their education. Akouvi sells small fish in her neighborhood to make a livelihood. Akouvi resupplies three times per month at the market. To order baskets of fish, Akouvi is requesting this loan to fulfill her purchase and to obtain the profit she needs.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of little fish.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Evelyn has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional pigs, sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Evelyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jo Ann

texts.en:
Jo Ann is 35 years old and married with four children who are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Jo Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, coffee, soft drinks, juice, cooking oil, etc.

Jo Ann has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, coffee, soft drinks, juice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: From her desire to help her husband in raising their big family, Lilia is making a profit through her peanut vending business. She is 60 years old with seven children. She never gets tired of selling her peanuts. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it, but it is a big help for her family. Lilia is a new member of PMPC. Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase more raw peanuts for her chosen business, so that she can be able to sell more and increase her income. Lilia continues to look for better business ideas to improve and expand her business and be able to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw peanuts so that she can sell more and increase her income.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora toils the land and grows rice. She engages in farming and sells rice. She is a 64-year-old married woman with two children ages 21 and 19 year old respectively. She has also been engaged in a bakery for five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband also has a small business which helps to meet their daily needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. These will help increase her farm's yield and she will be able to sell more sacks of rice. She will earn more and be able to provide for the needs of her growing children.

She dreams to expand her business to be able to improve the status of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Rowena has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she requested a loan to build concrete pigpens that would support sanitation and care for the environment. Rowena wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.name: Erasma

texts.en:
A hardworking mother best describes Erasma. She is 46 years old and residing at Ozamiz City, Philippines. Erasma has five children and is married to a construction worker. The wages that her husband gets are not enough to sustain the daily needs of their family. So Erasma started a food stand business. She has been in the business more than two years now. 

Erasma wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profits and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children. She wants to be able to send them all to college. In order for Erasma to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 5,000 for additional capital, and will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings, and all the ingredients, utensils, and other things that are needed for the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings, and all the ingredients, utensils, and other things that are needed for the food stand.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a businesswoman in Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is 44 years old and a microfinance member of PMPC. She has a retailing business, buying and selling a variety of commodities in the local community. 

Running this type of business, she has supported her family, especially the education of her children. Recently, she's seeking a loan through PMPC for additional working capital for her existing business, to buy a variety of commodities and food products to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 52, is married with six adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for three years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. 

Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rolida

texts.en:
Rolida is 56 years old and widow with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rolida has a business selling spices in the Philippines. Rolida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

Rolida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rolida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 27 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Jenny has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries like noodles, sardines, eggs, etc. Jenny has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like noodles, sardines, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos, 4 de ellos estudian.

Antonio, trabaja en los oficios domésticos, mientras su esposo se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace 10 años, también trabaja en la siembra de granos básicos para el consumo del hogar.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que se acerca la temporada de sembrar y tiene que preparar la tierra.

Su sueño, es tener una buena cosecha y poder darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 37, went to school through the third grade.  She is married and has five children.  Four of them go to school.

Antonia works doing the household chores while her husband works at growing vegetables, which he has been doing for ten years.  He also grows basic grains for household consumption.

She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies.  Planting season is coming, and supplies are needed to prepare the land.

Her dream is to have a good harvest and to be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to resell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to resell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 55 years old and has four children.  She is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Veronica has been in business for 32 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Santos Orlando

texts.es:
Santos, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado y es padre de tres hijos, dos niñas y un niño, todos están estudiando.

Santos, trabaja en construcción, su lugar de trabajo está lejos de su casa, es por eso que tiene que viajar en todos los días; en su tiempo libre se dedica a trabajar sembrando granos básicos para el consumo del hogar, su esposa le ayuda con los ingresos, dedicando un poco de su tiempo a vender productos de revistas.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para la preparación de una pequeña parcela donde cultiva, porque se acerca la temporada de sembrar.

El sueño de Orlando, es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old. He has a fourth grade education and is married with three children: two girls and a boy. All of the children go to school.

Santos works in construction.  His place of work is far from his house.  Therefore, he needs to travel every day.  In his free time he works at growing basic grains for household consumption.  His wife helps him with the income by spending a bit of her time selling products from magazines.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies to prepare a small piece of land that he cultivates because planting season is approaching.

Orlando’s dream is to improve his family’s quality of life and to be able to help with his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to prepare a small piece of land that he cultivates.

loans.name: Somoun's Group

texts.en: Somoun’s group members live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Somoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
Having successfully managed her superior quality pig rearing program, Ni Ketut got high sales results. She was able to set aside some of her profit to be saved and used for working capital.

The main goal of Ni Ketut and the other members of Tunas Mekar Asih group is to grow their savings to the point where they can continue their pig-raising businesses with their own capital. This is also the main goal of MUK, to help women acquire and manage their own businesses and eventually have their own capital.

With 10 members, the Tunas Mekar Asih group received loans totalling 15,000,000 IDR. Each received 1,500,000 IDR. Ni Ketut, the group leader, will use the loan to buy two piglets and feed. After being maintained for two months, all of the piglets will be sold and she will use the profit to fix her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy 2 piglets and feed

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela is married and she makes a good living with every quarter on her coconut farm in Dicoyong, Sindangan, in the Philippines. This is the primary source of income for her family. 

Tarcela has been able to provide her children with a good education until they graduated and secured stable jobs. She pawned (rented) her 2-hectare cocoland when her children entered college. 

Now, she wishes to pay for the acquisition of her rented cocoland. She wants to plant more dwarf coconuts and bananas on the land, for which she applied for an amount of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Tarcela has high hopes that she will have a high yield on her farm next quarter.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of her pawned cocoland.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 34 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. Rosanna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy piglets, sacks of feeds, and other supplies for her pig-raising business.

Rosanna has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from a gravel and sand business. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets, sacks of feeds, and other supplies for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Ma. Eliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma.Eliza works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. Ma.Eliza is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma.Eliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcelina is 60 years old now.

She has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of eggs to sell.

She has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
An $800.00 loan is offered to Apolonia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. 

She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, fish, beer, shampoo and rice. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Apolonia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, fish, beer, shampoo and rice.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a 29-year-old married man from Qalqilya City. He has a workshop for cutting natural stones to use in construction. It is a very good business but the machines and raw stones are very expensive.

Muhannad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new cutting machine for the stones. This will help him to improve his business and increase productivity.

Muhannad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new stone cutting machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a rammed-earth wall around her house.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman, 60 years old, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a pig-raising business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Salome has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Emeluz

texts.en:
Emeluz is a 43-year-old mother who was gifted with four children. She owns and manages a small retail store and provides a catering service for all occasions within their locality. This is her way of helping her husband in gaining income.

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of her children. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to avail herself of an additional loan of 20,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps and materials needed in providing services.

She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps and materials needed in a catering service

location.town: Brgy. Don Mariano Marcos, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is happily married and has two children. She has been engaged in a direct-selling business for more than two years. Marites plans to purchase stocks of perfume, hand and body lotion, underwear and shoes to sell. However, she does not have sufficient capital. 

For this reason, Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes to obtain this loan amount for the further growth of her direct-selling business and to satisfy all of her customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of perfume, hand and body lotion, underwear and shoes to sell

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 49 years old, she is married with 2 children and lives in Tudela.

Arsenia and her husband are earning a living through farming. They mastered doing this type of activity when they got married, and supported her children's education and their family's needs. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in February of 2012. She is a hardworking mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family.

Arsenia requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to have high crop yield on her vegetable farm and pay for higher yielding corn seed. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Someday she hopes to buy agricultural land to expand her farming activities and venture into agri-business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have high crop yield on her vegetable farm and pay for higher yielding corn seed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia manages her small restaurant business in Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering requests for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be really happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family.

Recently she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal finishing pellet feed for her hogs. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of working on swine production to expand her piggery business. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal finishing pellet feed for her hogs

loans.name: Lynbelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lynbelle works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lynbelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Lynbelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy, aged 38, is married with six children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Mary Joy runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, diapers and other groceries. 

Mary Joy has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Joedilla

texts.en:
Joedilla, aged 37, is single. She has operated a general store business in the Philippines for the past 15 years.

Joedilla has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like diapers, canned goods, shampoo, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as diapers, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Minda works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bananas. Minda is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32 year-old married man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his wife and kids in a small simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. His income barely covers all the family's needs. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all what is needed.
Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will decrease the usage of electricity for the family.
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Chiradee

texts.en:
Chiradee, aged 24, is a hard-working mother from Tudela. She is a businesswoman who makes copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). For this purpose, she buys whole coconuts. 

Chiradee has signed up as a member with the cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to insurance and credit. She has applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Chiradee hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, aged 49, is married with nine children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Anabelle works hard to support her family.

Anabelle has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a tricycle passenger service. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing sales business, such as blouses, school uniforms, and pants.

Anabelle has been sustaining her business activities with help from her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing such as blouses, school uniforms, and pants.

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cepriana is 61 years old now.

Cepriana has a broom making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like bamboo, etc..

Cepriana has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Cepriana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business like bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Fe has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Fe has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felisa is 43 years old now.

Felisa has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Felisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans  et vit à Avédji. Mère de cinq enfants, Afi est très entreprenante et dynamique. Afi fait les soins de beauté à ses clients  afin de trouver son gain. Afi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des vernis pour les soins de beauté, Afi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif et satisfaire davantage ses clients afin d’avoir un bon profit
texts.en: Afi is a 30 year old married woman and lives in Avédji. A mother to five children, Afi is very enterprising and dynamic. Afi does beauty treatments for her clients to gain a profit. Afi resupplies three times per month at the market. To buy nail polish for the beauty treatments, Afi is requesting this loan to achieve her goal and to better satisfy her clients in order to have a greater profit.

loans.use: to buy two dozens of nail polish.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more items such as sugar, canned goods, candies, as well as other groceries.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 12 years, though she also earns income from selling frozen foods.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, canned goods, candy, as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Noemi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemi, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, actualmente ella y sus hijos viven con sus padres.

Noemi, trabaja en una cooperativa, realizando diferentes actividades, su lugar de trabajo está a una hora de su casa y les proporcionan transporte.- 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, para que su padre pueda preparar la tierra, para sembrar granos básicos.

El sueño de Noemi, en un futuro es poder mejorar su casa y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Noemi is 31 years old; she studied up to the fifth grade. She is a single mother of 2. Noemi and her children currently live with her parents.

Noemi works in a cooperative, doing different activities. Her workplace is located one hour away from her home and they provide her with transportation.

She needs a loan to buy farming consumibles, so that her parents can prepare the earth to plant basic grains.

Noemi's dream for the future is to to make improvements in her home and to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming consumibles, so that her parents can prepare the earth to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 32 years old and has 2 children. One of her children is in school, and she works very hard to provide for both of them.

Jasmin runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell such as canned goods, cigarettes, home care products, as well as other groceries.

Jasmin has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, cigarettes, home care products, as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Brenda Lisseth

texts.es:
Brenda, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un hijo de cuatro años de edad.

Brenda, tiene una tienda desde hace cuatro años, ella junto a su pareja decidieron colocar su propia tienda, para que ella la atendiera, mientras realiza los quehaceres del hogar y él trabaja en la agricultura.- Antes de este negocio ella se dedicaba a vender tostadas, enchiladas, empanadas y otros antojitos, todo lo vendía en su casa.

Brenda, necesita para comprar 1 quintal de azúcar, tres cajas de jabón y una caja de aceite, con el crédito ella cubrirá la necesidad de productos más demandados en su tienda.

Brenda, sueña con ampliar su casa y hacer una bodega, aparte para colocar los productos de su tienda, también, desea que su hijo estudie y obtenga un título universitario para que su futuro sea prometedor y muy bueno.
texts.en:
Brenda is 20 years old and has a third-grade education. She is also a wife and the mother of a four-year-old son. Her husband is a farmer, but Brenda has for the past four years run a grocery store. Before she started this business, she sold food from home: tostadas, enchiladas, empanadas, and other items. 

Brenda and her husband decided to open their own store so that she could run it while managing their household and he worked in the fields. 
 
Sugar, soap, and cooking oil are three of the most popular products in her store. Brenda is therefore applying for a loan to purchase 1 quintal (100 pounds) of sugar, three cases of soap, and a case of cooking oil. 

In addition to growing her inventory, Brenda hopes to enlarge her home and expand the store. She also wants her son to study and earn a university degree so that he'll have a bright and promising future.

loans.use: to purchase a 1 quintal (100 pounds) of sugar, three cases of soap, and a case of cooking oil for her store.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa vit à Avédji et est âgée de 33 ans. Yawa est une femme mariée et habite avec ses quatre enfants. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens, Yawa fait le commerce de friperies afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Yawa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Yawa demande ce prêt pour acheter des slips pour équiper son étagère afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce
texts.en: Yawa is 33 years old and lives in Avédji. Yawa is a married woman and lives with her four children. To better fulfill daily needs, Yawa sells used cloths in order to gain a revenue that can provide for daily costs. Yawa resupplies four times per month at the market. Yawa is requesting this loan to buy underwear to fill her shelves in order to make the necessary profit to overcome her challenges and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozens of underwear

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo vit à Vakpossito et est âgée de 27 ans. Adjo est une femme marié avec ses trois enfants à charge. Pour mieux aider aux besoins quotidiens, Adjo fait le commerce de friperies et des sacs afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Adjo demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de voyage pour équiper son étagère afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et améliorer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo is 27 years old and lives in Vakpossito. Adjo is a married woman with three children in her care. To better fulfill daily needs, Adjo sells used cloths and bags in order to gain the necessary profit to provide for daily expenses. Adjo resupplies three times per month at the market. Adjo is requesting this loan to buy travel bags to stock her shelves so that she can make the profit she needs to overcome her challenges and to improve her children's education.

loans.use: To buy 51 travel bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snack foods, candies, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, and rice to resell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Vilma is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more clothes to offer for sale.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenelyn is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Jenelyn has a broom-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bamboo sticks and other materials needed for her business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo sticks and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marilyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Thim

texts.en: Thim is 58 years old and married. She is a rice farmer with four children who are factory workers. She is from the Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 15 years. Her husband is a 61-year-old village chief. The family can make around 22.50 USD per day. Now Thim would like to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use. She lacks the finances, so she is applying for a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a motorcycle for her children and improve their traveling conditions. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to build a new, proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies and needed in her ornamental business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy the fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires, and nets she needs for growing her ornaments that add color and beauty to landscaping. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Erlinda dreams to grow and be more successful in her ornamental farm. She aims to improve her quality of life and prays for good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Rufina works hard to support her family.

Rufina has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines, though she also earns additional income from running a general store. She is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business.

Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
Ritchelle is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ritchelle is 26 years old now.

Ritchelle has a broom-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo sticks and other materials needed for her business.

Ritchelle has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 35 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Virgilia is in the agricultural business farming fruits in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virgilia has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Cecil

texts.en:
Ma. Cecil is 46 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Cecil is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Cecil requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Cecil has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 63 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child in school.

Amada is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Amada has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gunara

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Gunara. Gunara lives in West Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Gunara owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He joined Ruma last year and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to expand his business using technology. His community sees him as trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Gunara needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credit to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Gunara’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Gunara is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Dedeh

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Dedeh. Dedeh lives in West Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Dedeh owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income so they can save more money for their child’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Dedeh needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Dedeh’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Dedeh is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Jenny Lyne

texts.en: Jenny Lyne is 29 years old, married and blessed with four children. She helps her husband gain income by operating a tailoring business within their locality. She aims to continue and improve this business, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP10,000.00 to buy garments, needles, thread, hooks and eyes and buttons needed in her tailoring shop. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that someday she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy garments, needles, thread, hooks and eyes and buttons

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda works hard to support herself.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Luvisminda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, diapers, sugar and school supplies to sell for her general store business.

Luvisminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, diapers, sugar and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 54 years old and married with six children.

Ines works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home care products and groceries.

Ines has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from coffee making.

Ines aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Leda

texts.en:
Leda is 35 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Leda works very hard to provide for them.

Leda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bottled water, home care products and groceries.

Leda has been in this business for 9 years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Leda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bottled water, home care products and  groceries

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nerisa is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nerisa has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nerisa has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Nerisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Roslainie

texts.en:
Roslainie is 30 years old with 4 children ages 5, 4, 3 and 2 years old. She manages her sari-sari store (grocery store). She did not finish college because her parents could not afford to support her. Her business started with PhP 2,000 working capital she borrowed from her relatives. She bought groceries and put up her sari-sari store in front of her house. Her store gains a net of PhP 200-250 daily which helps them in their daily expenses. She wants to expand her business to save for her children education, but she lacks the capital.

Roslainie's first loan amounting to PhP 5,000 was used as additional capital for her sari-sari grocery store.
Through a series of loans, Roslainie's business improved. Her store now holds more items and gains a net of PhP 400-500 daily and she added 3 computers and opened a computer shop, which her husband operates.

Roslainie is now requesting another loan amounting to PhP 25,000 to buy 3 sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of canned goods as additional items to sell in her grocery store and 2 pieces of a desktop computer set as additional computers for her computer shop. This will help her increase the potential of gaining more customers and increasing her income.

Roslainie wants to expand her store more and add more computers in the future.  She also wants to learn other business skills so she can improve her store to earn better profits and can save enough for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of canned goods and 2 pieces of a desktop computer set

loans.name: Jose Buenaventura

texts.es:
José, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de seis hijos, pero en casa solo viven dos de ellos y los demás están casados.
 
José, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, toda su vida se ha dedicado a este oficio, lo aprendió de su padre, puesto él hacía lo mismo.- José, recibió capacitaciones por personeros del Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería  y ellos le proporcionaron algunos insumos y fue así como decidió dedicarse a este negocio, porque también es rentable, otra actividad económica es la siembra de granos básicos, la siembra de hortalizas está a 5 minutos de su casa, su esposa y sus hijos lo apoyan cuando tiene tiempo.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar 1 quintal de hierro, para sostener la maya de un macro túnel, para proteger los cultivos de tomate y chile y comprar fertilizantes y plaguicidas, con ello tendrá menos incidencia de plagas y enfermedades para que su producción y será más rentable.

Toda su vida ha soñado con tener una gran parcela de hortalizas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Jose, is 54 years old; he studied up to highschool. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. He is the father of six children but only two live at home and the rest are married.

Jose grows vegetables, he has been doing this all of his life. He learned it from his father who used to do the same. Jose received training from personnel from the Ministry of Agriculture and Cattle and they provided him with some consumibles and that is how he decided to stay in this business but it is also profitable. Another economical activity is growing basic grains. His vegetable garden is five minutes away from his home and his wife and children help him when they have time.

Jose needs the loan to buy one quintal of iron to reinforce the wire mesh of a macro tunnel to protect the tomatoe and pepper plants and to buy fertilizers and pesticides. With this his harvest will have less incidences of pests and sickness and will be more profitable.

All of his life he has dreamed of having a large plot of vegetables and basic grains.
.

loans.use: to buy 1 quintal of iron to reinforce the wire mesh of a macro tunnel to protect the tomatoe and pepper plants and to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is happy that she was previously granted a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos, which she used to buy materials for her T-shirt printing business. Her earnings are a great help toward sending her children to school and providing their daily sustenance.

Arlene would now like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP, which she would use to buy paints, screens and T-shirts, as well as clothing and other items for her business. She is encouraged by good sales and the return on her investment, as it really covers her family's everyday expenses and her children's education. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that she will receive. 

Arlene hopes to find a good location to expand her business. She aims to send all her children to college and to see them become professionals some day. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  shirt printing supplies for her T-shirt business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old and married with three children. One of her children is in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carita De Angel Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad, y su negocio es la venta y elaboración de chorizo.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, activa, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Mutualista’ una área céntrica que ospeda a edificios comerciales, públicos, universidades, escuelas y todo tipo de negocios, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro, viste solera blanca y lleva unas hojas en la mano). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayo está iniciando la escuela el menor aún es un bebé, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a los gastos y necesidades de su familia, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de perfumes, venta de artículos de limpieza, servicio de plomería y limpieza de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus ingresos. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de chorizo del tipo ‘beniano’; elaborado con tripa delgada de res, carne molida de res, carne molida de cerdo, tocino, cebolla, aribibi, vinagre, ajo, comino, pimienta y sal. El procedimiento que sigue es; lava la tripa, en un sartén fríe la cebolla con el ajo, para luego mezclar todos los ingredientes y con la ayuda de un embudo; mete los ingredientes dentro de la tripa, con un hilo amarra los costados dándole la medida apropiada para que entre en un plato. “aprendí esta receta de la familia, luego me dedique a esta actividad como forma de vida y porque puedo cuidar a mis hijos y trabajar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su receta es muy popular y los fines de semana vende chorizo por mayor para las parrillas familiares, la desventaja es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para elaborar mayor cantidad de chorizos y aumentar sus ventas. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de venta de chorizos y embutidos, ella desea realizar la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de chorizos por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para elaboración de chorizos para vender por mayor y abrir una tienda de embutidos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 22-year-old woman.  She is a single mother of a 6-year-old child and a 1-year-old child.  Her business is the making and selling of chorizo sausage.

She is a good mother, enterprising, active, patient, responsible and hard-working.  Her business is carried out in the area “Mutualista,” a central area that accommodates commercial buildings, universities, schools, many people and all types of businesses.  It has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 18 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Carmen is dark-complexioned, short, thin, with brown eyes and long black tied-up hair. Her mother tongue is Guarani which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business that she is in. (In the photo she is in the centre, dressed in white and she has some papers in her hand.)

She shares her life with her children.  The older one is starting school and the younger one is still a baby.  They live in a rented room made of brick and cement with a sheet-metal roof.  It has potable water, electricity and a sewer system.  Due to expenses and family necessities, she formed a bank of people with businesses such as food sales, vegetable sales, sale of second-hand clothing, sale of perfumes, sale of cleaning supplies, plumbing services and clothes-cleaning services in order to request a loan and to improve earnings.

Her business is the making and selling of “beniano” type of chorizo.  It is made with thin meat intestine, ground beef, ground pork, bacon, onion, chili peppers, vinegar, garlic, cumin, salt and pepper.  The procedure that she follows is:  she washes the intestines; in a frying pan she fries the onion with garlic; then mixes all the ingredients and with the help of a funnel she puts the ingredients inside the intestine; with a thread she ties the sides giving it the appropriate dimensions for a serving. “I learned this recipe from my family.  Then I dedicated myself to this occupation as a way of life and because I can take care of my children and work,” she says.

The advantage of her business is that her recipe is very popular and on the weekends she sells chorizo wholesale for family barbecues.  The disadvantage is that she doesn't have sufficient capital to make a greater quantity of chorizos and increase her sales.  Her dream is to open a store to sell chorizos and sausages.  She wishes to be able to buy the ingredients for making chorizos wholesale.  This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the 3 years that she has been carrying out this activity.

It is for these reasons that Carmen is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for making chorizos to sell wholesale and to open a sausage store.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chorizos to sell wholesale and to open a sausage store.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 55 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Felicidad is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Felicidad has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Soksanneary

texts.en: Soksanneary is a 32-year-old single factory worker who is working in the city and she is from Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been working as a factory worker since 2013, making approximately $6 per day. Soksanneary is lacking the money to buy a motorcycle to commute to work, therefore she needs a loan. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy a motorcycle and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning is 48 years old, with 6 children where in the oldest is 23 and the youngest is 3 years old. Her husband works in a printing shop as printing operator and his income of PhP 400 daily is barely enough to support their expenses and not enough for the schooling of their children. In order to help out she does clothing repair using her mother’s old sewing machine. Her business gains her a net of PhP 150 daily. She wanted to add a rug business to her store to increase her income and save up, but she lacks capital

Her first loan amounting to PhP 5,000 was used to buy kilos of used fabrics to be made into rugs and sell it to her customers.

Through a series of loans, Luningning rug business improved, she now delivers sacks of her rugs to her customers and the orders are growing. The revenue helps her in their expenses and the schooling of her children.

Luningning now is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 16,000 to buy 10 sacks of used clothes, 65 yards of used fabrics, and 20 spools of thread, to make rugs and fill the orders of her customers. 

Luningning wants to improve her business to help her children continue their education and help her community by recycling used fabrics.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of used clothes, 65 yards of used fabrics, and 20 spools of thread, to make rugs to fill the orders of her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a store owner. She has been running her variety store for more than 13 years. Aside from selling grocery items, she also engaged herself into hog raising business as additional family source of income. 

At her age 55, she aims for stable source of income.To make it possible, she is seeking for additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 to re-stock her variety store.She will use her loan in buying grocery items such as soft drinks, detergent soap, cooking oil, and other dry goods to sell. She hopes that through this loan amount she could improve her variety store and hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, detergent soap, cooking oil,  and other dry goods to sell

loans.name: Mosoc Runa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MOSOC RUNA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la señora Patricia, la socia continua dedicándose al  negocio de venta de plantas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua  vendiendo diferentes tipos de plantas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, ferretería, carpintería.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud, los socios se comprometen salir todos juntos en la foto para la próxima reunión.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank Mosoc Runa, which is located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco. Her name is Patricia and she continues with her business of selling plants. She is responsible and persistent, and continues to sell diverse plants for all the clients that request them. This is the way she helps her family get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds among other items. The other members work selling clothing, in a hardware store, and in carpentry. The members shown in the enclosed picture asked for permission to arrive late for the meeting because of their work or health. They made a commitment to be together in one picture for the next meeting.

loans.use: To buy seeds among other items.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 40 years old, married, and has two kids whom he is sending to school. His wife is working abroad as domestic helper. With his desire to help his wife to meet their daily expenditures and have stable income, Benson engage himself in butchering and selling of port meat. 

He also runs their motorcycle for passenger’s transportation. Benson wish to grow his business and increase his income. Thus, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fuel, tires, and other accessories for his motorcycle. He will also use his loan to buy hogs for butchering and sell meat. He will do his best to gain enough for the future of his family. Someday he and his wife will manage the business he invests in.

loans.use: to buy fuel, tires, and other accessories for his motorcycle.

loans.name: El Junco (Tosagua) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito El Junco  está formado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo con el cual esperan mejorar sus negocios y su vida en familia, ellos se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Junco del  cantón Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
Una de las socias de este grupo  la señora Mercedes, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor de 14 años la misma que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Mercedes  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí ella con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido de la Fundación ha podido de a poco ir mejorando su negocio, ella vende víveres de toda clase como  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, golosinas, entre otras. Cada vez que recibe un crédito lo invierte en más variedad de productos lo cual le ha servido para aumentar su clientela, lleva 3 años con su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo con lo cual en ocasiones salen adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en el campo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres de toda clase. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños seguir mejorando su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "El Junco" communal bank is made up of 11 women and two men who some time back decided to get together hoping to improve their businesses and the lives of their families. They meet every fortnight in El Junco of Tosagua canton. This place is known as being very dynamic and where the majority of inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals and to be an area of lush vegetation.

One of the members of the group is Mercedes. She is 40 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has 4 children from this relationship. Three of them adults and the youngest is 14 and studies in secondary school. Her husband is a farmer.

Mercedes has a food store in her house and here she is improving her business little by little with the support she she has received from the Foundation. She sells all kinds of food like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables, and sweets amongst others. Each time she gets a loan she invests it in more variety of products and this has worked to increase her clientele. She has had the business for 3 years which has allowed her to earn something with which to get ahead as her husband doesn't earn much working in the fields.

She will use this loan to buy all kinds of foods. She has been in the communal bank since it's beginning and she likes it as thanks to the loans she could expand her business. Her dream is to continue to expand her business and provide the best for her children. The adjoined photo is of 3 members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 55 años de edad, es separado, vive en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la ganadería, comercio y agricultura.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de albañilería, contando con herramientas propias, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El presente crédito será utilizado para realizar mantenimiento a sus herramientas así como para la compra de herramientas nuevas para su negocio. Esta inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, lo que tendrá una gran influencia en el negocio incrementando su nivel de ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 55 years old, separated, and lives in a rural area in the district of Oyotún, which is located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast.  The inhabitants of this district work in ranching, commerce, and farming.  

He works in construction and has his own tools.  His business is located in his home.  He has over 15 years of experience in this business and he has steady customers who can offer very good personal and professional references for him.  This loan will be used to perform maintenance on his tools and to buy new tools for his business.  This investment will help him keep his equipment and tools in better shape, which will have a huge influence on his business, increase his income, and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his tools and to buy new tools for his business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel earns a living by providing p.o. (purchase orders) to  the locals in her place.These can be used  to purchase items in grocery and department stores  respectively.  She also sells purified drinking water.   Aside from that, she also engages in selling Vita Plus--a natural health drink with varieties of flavor. She is a 42-year-old  married woman with three children from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 14. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase more p.o. cards and more stock of Vita Plus products. These stocks are very helpful in augmenting her income. She could now have more  stocks and customers have a wide variety to choose from.  With these, she could  balance her finances and settle her obligations.

Raquel  dreams to expand her business to make it sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase more p.o. cards and more stock of Vita Plus products

loans.name: Nestoria

texts.en:
Nestoria, 52, is a farmer. She grow and sells rice. She has three children ages 17,13 and 10. Nestoria and her family lives in Getafe, Bohol.

Nestoria has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer to improve her crop yield and increase her income. She wants to prepare healthy food to her entire family and meet their basic needs including a quality education.

She dreams to expand her business and to make it more sustainable. She hopes to set aside some savings for a home renovation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hector Jaiter

texts.es:
Hector tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarguera, realiza esta actividad hace 05 años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.
